CMHahMBhkv0uFF-GuOaNmA.text: Been there a couple times in the past...Dont know what all the hype is...Went there yesterday 1/23/14..Cashier unpleasant to work with..She wasnt paying attention.. I find the menu a little over priced for the end result... I had the pork sandwich..it was very small..  The sauce was way way watered down (thin)... The mac and cheese was weak at best...ive had better Craft from the box...Im not a big fan of RC fountain drinks...(wtf is up with that ?)   When i went to put my tray away the garbage can was over filled with trash on the floor next to it..I balanced my tray on top and quietly left..Not a "goodbye" from the counter or a "yall come back"    nothing....    What happend to this place ?  Did they change owners ?  I just dont get it...                                                                                                           I dont think ill be back /

un5pOxMohQ8DiWv9YkWIzA.text: * I brought the Groupon deal "$10 for $20 worth of barbecue, sides, and drinks" might as well while I travel on budget. I got here on Wednesday at 1ish, there are 3-4 customer eating at the table, no customer in line.  I ordered the ribs and chicken bbq. The sides are alright, the chicken is realy good. The ribs are so dry. But the bbq sauces are soooooo good. I love the bbq sauces. I won't not come back unless I have another Groupon deal. I will only get the chicken next time.

sGDgIybl2fcaq5aNzzFcIg.text: Everything here is good. I love the barbeque sauce and the peach cobbler is to die for!

eP97-T6cx_mhxiS_N9OJGQ.text: Cute little BBQ joint!  I mean who doesn't love bears and an adorable catering van parked outside?  Reminds of smokey the bear actually and I'd almost  imagine smokey bear looking at honey bear warning not to start forest fires when bbqing.  Anyways, on to the review!  Fast food style BBQ- I ordered the 3 slider combo which is great so you can try all theme meats.  I liked the pulled pork the best although it's a little on the dry side.  The sauce is awesome and does a great job masking any noticeable dryness if you spread it out.  You also get a side (can't go wrong with Mac n cheese) that comes in a to go container which is great if you can't finish all your food.  I love the fact that the place is family owned and it's a great atmosphere in the establishment with several historically meaningful pictures of it.  The garbage system needs an update as the hole to actually dump garbage is tiny and causes sauce to spill all over the sides and for customers to actually put effort in aiming their disposal of goods.

xhhE5qNrDmscJYqiQevFmQ.text: New ownership maybe but it's not the same here. Cashier wasn't friendly. The high chairs were so messy with caked in food. It took me many wipes to get it suitable for my son to sit in and eat in. Wires hanging down from window lights.  Napkin dispensers empty during dinner time. Come on!

QTKnDq6kn33gz9WvEx988A.text: This place is average. I had the vm1 with bbq chicken sandwich and potato salad. The meal was out quick and it was relatively cheap. The chicken was a touch dry for my liking, the bun was a little soggy and the bbq sauce had a watery consistency and lacked flavor. The potato salad was pretty good and a large portion.

dPjltT6DoMt69gdQ2BOBAA.text: I can't get over what a jerk the counter guy was. There were three of us. He got our order wrong, but I didn't want to get into it with the guy after having witnessed the fight the guy in front of me had with him. To say it was a fight is a misnomer. The guy just didn't care. He looked at the ticket. Shrugged his shoulders and pointed to a cup on the wall. The customer was disputing the order, not the cup on the wall. The customer looked at me as if to say "Is this really going on". I am not sure if the cashier is special needs or just resigned to sitting on that stool day after day knowing it will never get better. I didn't want to get too close to him lest a part of my soul was sucked into his whirlpool of misery.  There was no ice for the iced tea or soda. The soda came out of the machine flat, stick with the lemonade, at least it was this side of lukewarm. The chicken was disgusting. It was dry, the outside was hard. The ribs (I ordered a half and got a full), were delicious as was the pulled pork. The links were good but hotter than they should be. Stay way from the bro'beans. Potato Salad is good mustard. Cole Slaw was good as was the Mac'n'Cheese. As good as the food is, it doesn't make up for the cashier. The cook came out from the back and was a delight. She was very sweet when she apologized for the chicken and gave me a second one but the meal was already over. I hadn't complained to anyone except my dining companions so I don't know if they served me the bad chicken knowing it wasn't good or if they have listening devices so they can laugh at the misery of their guests. Save yourselves, either abandon all hope before entering here or better yet, don't go.

nJfyInMckpiydiKfPRmmFw.text: Food was okay BBQ brisket sandwich wasn't bad ...Mac & cheese was a little runney for my likening ...  Hot link wasn't really a hot more like a sausage link..

qc0pbbs21TDL5pTcfI-C3g.text: A valley staple. I am not the biggest BBQ or smoked meat fan but the food is good and the portions are huge. If you like BBQ and Soul food check it out. Their Sweet Potato Pie (and surprisingly potato salad) is extremely delish!

Tvx0-PxBAwI9tpla27PTeA.text: "You don't need no teeth to eat our meat"  Haha, what else needs to be said.  This place is a solid BBQ joint.  I'm from the southeast and I love pork BBQ.  I was raised on NC style (from southern VA) but I appreciate all BBQ's.  This place is pretty great.  It's inexpensive.  Decent customer service.  Cheap beer.  Very little fat/gristle in the pulled pork which is something I pay very close attention to.    If you're looking for something quick, easy, inexpensive and delicious give this place a try.

BkZmS_ruWiYM8ypOYp6KCg.text: I had a $20 Groupon for this place, so I decided to try it out on Friday. The food was awesome! The portions were huge too! I had 4 meals for a little over $20. I ordered the half rack ribs with two sides.  I also ordered the beef brisket. The ribs were meaty tender and had good smoky flavor. I typically don't like my ribs swimming in BBQ sauce and was kind of disappointed to see sauce slathered all over the ribs but It worked. I was pleasantly surprised at how tasty they were and the sauce was not overwhelming at all. I ordered a half rack but it seemed that there was a racks worth of ribs (they must be some huge racks)! I will definitely be trying this place again!

b739-sO8He2PT224Zz1Fmw.text: OK, I am a Certified BBQ Judge, and was very disappoint with my visit Sunday night.    Cold food, ribs had no meat on them, even my 6 year old said 'wow they don't have a good cook here daddy'  Out of forks, out of salad?    Waited 40 min for cold food?  Please explain....  And one of the dirtiest bathrooms I have every seen.

o7oOMY8riUebenXqMT3qIw.text: Honeybears is a cutty little BBQ spot that does have some highlights. Their pulled chicken mini sandwiches, spicy beans, mac & peach cobbler are all really good. They have a great soda selection, and small dining area to eat there. Memphis style, which doesn't step to the Missouri BBQ I was raised on, but none the less still great. They always have a Groupon  or Yelp deal too.

b-OSjSWWC-noaFvmllRVKg.text: Over priced food, served without a plate, in a real dump. I'm a BBQ lover but I don't love Honey Bear's.  I had the same impression of the one located in central Phoenix too but wanted to try once more before deciding I didn't like their food. Decision made.

XxpyvdrYpXZJ2wDgnYXbvw.text: Stopped here after a Group-On promo. The person at the register, like many of the reviews below, was not the friendliest in the world but then I came here for BBQ and not to make a new friend.   Ordered the 1/2 rack of ribs, hot link on the side and cole slaw and potato salad. The ribs truthfully were very good, some of the best I have had in a long time. The BBQ sauce was also excellent but more of a mid-west style and tasty.   I cannot say how the hot link was because they shorted me on this! Sorry but ordering something then paying for it and finding it missing once you get home just is not right. Really gave me a bad taste in my mouth over the place...   I have one more Group-On voucher and am using it this week. This time eating inside so lets see if they short me on anything else this time...  ~~~~~~~~ UPDATE! Returned to Honey Bears on Friday and first off the person working the register was a lot nicer to work with. Also mentioned that I had been shorted a hot link and she took care of it, giving me an extra one today.   Had the ribs again and once again they were excellent. Also got a BBQ Beef sandwich to go for lunch the next day and it was very good as well.   Course when I was at the restaurant this time the soda fountain stopped working and as usual it was AFTER several of us had paid for drinks. Oh well...

Cm5wY8MZWNOsOZLn60-Swg.text: I've heard honey bears was good and wanted to try it out. Unfortunately, this was the worst BBQ place I've ever been to. I ordered a full rack of ribs, and out of the 12 ribs, I only had 2 that were actually tender. The rest were tough and fatty. I'm pretty sure they were a few days old as well. The sides and the sauce were pretty good though.   I was very disappointed and will not be back to either location.

CfCJ-0iWZ0lHlQlPKyBP-g.text: This is some good stuff.  Ordered the slider meal - which allowed me to sample the chicken, pork and beef BBQ for roughly 10 bucks.  I asked for some hot BBQ sauce on the side (they did not have it out on the tables) and went to town on this meal.  The meal was enough to make me satisfied without feeling like I ate too much.  The BBQ sauce on the sliders was more than sufficient but I am one of those guys that likes to douse their meat in BBQ sauce (otherwise it just does not feel right) .   Honey Bears was bare bones in decor but for a BBQ place, I am not judging on the quality of their pictures on the wall but rather the tastiness of the meat.  I would come back to this place in a heartbeat!  Highly recommend.

LOgCSniogT-J3S1TJ9E7-g.text: Manager (Owner?) is very chill... Some people might not be used to it. It's a southern thing though! Lol... Anyways! The food is good, I always get either the pulled pork sandwich or the hot link sandwich. The BBQ is the ish!!!!!! I love it, can't get enough. I was reading some other reviews & all I can say is Love it or hate it, I happen to love it. PS: it's really not as bad as people make it seem... Give it a try.

1Eee2e66zOsEWW30WLFJNw.text: Right next door to where we just moved in to and even while we were moving we could smell the pit. :) When I saw the building I already knew it had potential.   I was told this location was the oldest and had better BBQ than others so with a Groupon Now I figured "why not". We were not disappointed whatsoever. This coming from a person who only eats his own BBQ and my family from Mississippi!  Had the 3 meat sampler to give all a whirl. Best were the ribs. Second, the beef. Third place tie goes to the pork and chicken but the sauce was great. Actually used it on my own slow cooked pulled pork for Super Bowl Sunday.   Overall. I loved it.

jKeMRQVE0FsfCt870o60bA.text: Last Friday we tempted fate and headed over to Honey Bear's BBQ restaurant in Phoenix. We equipped ourselves with full kevlar body suits complete with knee cap armor.  During lunch hours it can be hard to find a parking slot at Honey Bear's Bar-B-Q restaurant. There are probably 20 spots and most of them fill up pretty quickly. From the outside, Honey Bear's looks as if it has had it's share of violence and has survived through it all. Fortunately enough, the inside makes up for the outside, but only in part. The restaurant is clean and the food appears to be prepared in a clean environment. But the whole building and the front part sure could do with a fresh coat of paint. That whole part of Phoenix is pretty runned down anyways. Honey Bear's is probably the best kept of its neighbors. Even so, don't attempt to gamble with your life and walk from work to the restaurant, you might get stabbed or shot at or both -- you've been warned.  Many people in our office love Honey Bear's and if they had the chance would go and eat there every day. Out of the three times I've been to Honey Bear's during two of them I've gotten a BBQ sandwich and the other time I got a salad. The salad was nothing to write home about and honestly I didn't expect it to be. The place specializes in Tennessee style BBQ and not in salads. So if BBQ doesn't turn you on, then neither will Honey Bear's. The BBQ sandwiches at Honey Bear's never seem to impress me though. It just reminds me of sloppy joe and honestly I'd rather have a sandwich made with Manwich than with their BBQ chicken. Manwich is at the very least "managable". The meat on the sandwichs at Honey Bear's seem to be all over the place. It is uncontrollable almost. Their is no picking your sandwich up and eating it. If you try, it is just a mess. You end up having to eat your sandwich with a fork. Com'on now, is that how the people in Tennesee eat their sandwiches? With a fork? Yea, it's True what their moto says, "You don't need no teeth to eat our meat!", but I can guarantee you, you'll need a fork.  As for food presentation, Honey Bear's doesn't do so well. Their sandwiches come wrapped in tin foil and the first impression you get is that there was no care put into it when they made it. They just plopted the meat on and moved on to the next customer.  I have heard through various channels that Honey Bears tastes like cafateria food. Atleast I'm not the only hater.  The price for food at Honey Bear's is about $5 just for the sandwich alone. With a drink and a side order of something it will usually run you about $8. The whole menu is pretty much a-la-carte.  We will probably visit Honey Bear's agian because my co-workers have a thing for BBQ. But honestly, I think that Honey Bear's reputation is far better than their food and food presentation.

kfBOm4Ce0RPZgBhl5LuGIQ.text: I have had a Yelp account for 4 years and this is my first review,  We had attended the Southwest Cajun Festival today in downtown Chandler as we love Cajun and Southern cooking. While walking down the crowded streets looking for the next place to try we spot the Honey Bears Banner, the banner reads, Honey Bears, Gumbo, Jambalaya, Boudin, Etouffee, wish I would have taken a picture. As you can imagine the lines are 30-50 people long and you get in line about 50 feet away from the stand, so we decide to give them a try.   Lines at all the places were long so we expected this and discussed what food we liked so far and what we still would like to try, as well explained to my wife what Boudin was.   So after about 15-20 mins we finally worked our way up to the counter. Once at the counter we were greeted, what would you like, I quickly said I would love a bowl of Gumbo, and we will try the Boudin as well. The attendant replied, we don't have those items! With my puzzled look I asked what do you mean? The sign above my head reads Gumbo, Boudin, etc. The attendant then points to a small sign at the opposite end of the stand and sarcastically said these are the items we have. I then replied but you cannot see that sign walking by or standing in line, you should probably fix that, and the attendant replied well maybe you should learn how to read!   Restraining myself we walked away, this was the first and last time I will ever think about eating at Honey Bears.

Br6hkWViL2G608xY0orJtQ.text: Shared the brisket sandwich and rib combo with my fiance this evening. One side is included and then we added on another (mac n' cheese and coleslaw).  Portions are HUGE! Great bang for the buck. The ribs were juicy and sauce-y, brisket sandwich was flavorful and had awesome smokey notes to it.The coleslaw is similar to that of KFC's which in my book, is AH-MAZING. Standard back mac n' cheese, not too runny.  You'd never come here for ambience but the place is clean and there are a few TV's around.   My fiance has had lots and lots of BBQ and gave this place his stamp of approval, so we will definitely be returning!

MYh4GiArMdBfvqOULQR7gg.text: The pulled pork sandwich was good, but my wife and I occasionally found fatty pieces mixed in with the lean. We also had coleslaw and mac & cheese, which was overly salty. I would get potato salad instead of mac & cheese if we return there.   For True Tennessee style, the BBQ sauce needs more of a vinegar base. Or at least, a vinegar-based sauce should be available at the counter, marked Tennessee style.

220_9UtAgYdK5is3eWoNUw.text: Literally watched the guy throw my hot links for my sandwich in the DEEP FRYER. 'Nuff said. Fool me once.....

dLL0xtDH-P-p54goh-h9FQ.text: Not so sure about the employees working here. When I came in the guy working the counter was sitting down doing nothing in particular even though the napkin dispenser was completely empty and a few things around the store looked like they could use some cleaning.  He was reasonably polite in taking my order, but certainly not above and beyond.  After taking a couple orders he went right back down to sitting on his stool.  If he has a doctor's note or some disability, I sincerely apologize for my review, but I strongly believe that in a restaurant 'if you got time for leaning, you got time for cleaning' and any time I see employees sitting around with obvious things to be attended to I have to worry about other practices in the kitchen.  The BBQ was pretty decent. Not the very best, but no complaints either. Beans were top Notch.

Y0bKAomk7QcT_yv9Zs-6Sg.text: I would not recommend Not the Honey Bears I remember, counter service sucks. No more bar. If you like eating off a piece of aluminum foil this place is great, if you want a plate and utensils its $1.75 per person more. Beer was cheap and cold at 2.75 for a bud lite. Sides were nice and hot but the brisket was cold and the bun was as cheap as you can get. The corn on the Cobb was hot but old. Beans were good, as was the Mac and cheese. The brisket was not tasty at all bbq sauce was runny and tasteless over all I would not recommend coming to honey bears $30 bucks for two brisket sandwich with two sides and two beers.

Ce76TFX-CRbosUTi2FgkUg.text: Lunch at Honey Bears BBQ today. Arrived at 11:15 with four parties seated and three in line in front of me - good sign.   I ordered the BBQ pork, hot link, a side of slaw and a drink. He changed it to the # 1 value meal to save me money but it still came to $10.28.   Meal arrived in about 4 minutes and everything was hot but I was disappointed in most of it. Come slaw first: slaw was tangy, perfect spice and mayo level. Definitely would order again.   The pork and link came together in a HB bun. I got 2-3 ounces of pork and a three-inch link. Decent flavor but for $10, I should get more than 2-3 oz.  The link was good. It had good snap, excellent spice but just not much of it.  The meal came with a pint of BBQ sauce which was unexpected. The sauce had a slight amount of spice but was so sweet I couldn't put much on the Sammie. I suppose when you're called Honey BBQ, you make sweet sauce.   Around the corner is Hap's BBQ which I thought was better but Famous Dave's blows them both out with flavor and value.

Pk_F3klae2wVQK46niL4UQ.text: Like most people said, USE TO BE, good place. The bathroom is a mess! I got the brisket, couldn't really taste the smoke or BBQ of it, really plain.  The sauce in my opinion has gotten sweeter, use to have a kick but not no more. No salt packets! Every other packet besides salt! Lady behind the counter had to put some in a sauce cup. Use to live this place, but have second guess coming here now with so many more options. Hopefully the look at some reviews and step their game up.

_4ZjcSJCAVWm538Yo0rx9A.text: really good bbq joing. Coworker and I went and got some food. The Mac and Cheese was really good. I got the sliders of pulled pork sandwiches and they were really good as well. Definitely recommend this place.

2J_EMU5ycPoGXQOZOaO74Q.text: Pulled is very tender with just the right smoke flavor.  Cowbro beans are outstanding.  The sauce has a delicious Tennessee style sweet and spicy  zip to it.  After the food was eaten, I could help but have a little more sauce by itself.  Mac and cheese is ok but better when I added some sauce.  Staff is friendly.  Good place to stop for a quick takeout.  I went back again and tried eating in and having brisket.  It was good but the pork was better.  You pay on ordering and are shown a tip prompt on the tablet before signing for a credit card.  You don't get served at your table but instead are called back to the counter to pick up your door tray.

TS3pu7-zuQYvQEkHZP0GXA.text: I was really not impressed with the BBQ here. I decided to go because I read others' reviews and most of them said the food was good but my experience wasn't as fortunate, I guess.   I ordered the ribs and chicken combo plate with greens and Mac and cheese for my son and I. The chicken was very dry, just slathered in sauce. I nor my son wanted to eat it. The ribs were inconsistent. Some were tasty and moist; others extremely dry and chewy. None of them were fall off the bone good. It may be because they weren't freshly made (when I went in there was NOBODY in there and while I was there about an hour only one other customer came in).   My greens needed salt and lacked the savory taste that greens should give. My mac and cheese was just...not right. I tried saving it at home but it was unsalvageable. But in their defense I am very particular about my Mac and cheese.   Also, there were no options for non-carbonated drinks; not even sweet tea! I don't appreciate that. And they were out of cornbread.

wZap55KBy1zjLteNkcMUzw.text: I really wanted to like this place since I really dig family owned businesses I guess I will start my review by saying I ordered via phone but when I called I got an automated system that was horrible and didn't route you to anyone instead it said to call another number. After placing a huge order they said it would be done in 30 minutes. I went to pick up my order an hour later and it was still not ready and ended up waiting another 30 minutes when I looked around it seemed that everyone there was waiting for food and no food was being served in a timely matter. After finally getting my food I really wasn't impressed.   Pulled Pork-Dry Brisket-Dry Sauce-Weak and needed spice Baked Beans-Very good especially with the sausage  Hot Links- Not bad but not spicy Coleslaw- Very good  Corn Bread- bland and tasted old

pKI_v5luqK8c-y4wTHf76A.text: I was carving BBQ today and decided to go to Honey Bears. I hadn't been to Honey Bears in years, and this location in forever. Something has changed, apart from the looks, which now look old, unkempt, and run down, the food was...no bueno! I ordered a pulled pork sandwich combo and a hot link on the side. I paid almost 14 bucks. My combo came with the sandwich, a side, and a drink. The hot link was an extra $1.99. Now, I don't mind paying 14 bucks if the food is amazing, this was not the case. My sandwich had plenty of meat but it was just blah, nothing amazing, the bun was some generic bun that was super soggy from the meat. No, if my sandwich was made when I ordered it and I ate at the restaurant there is no reason my bun should be that soggy that fast. Right? Fine, I removed most of the bottom bun and spread the remaining meat on the top bun and ate that. The mac and cheese, oh man, the mac and cheese. It was lukewarm, it was not cheesy, or creamy, or anything. I took 2 small bites and asked to switched it out either for a hot mac and cheese or something else. The girl at the counter stood there for a bit, then went and asked the Spanish speaking lady in the kitchen if the mac and cheese was turned on since "the lady at the counter is saying it's not hot". She came back and asked me if I wanted something else other than the mac and cheese, I chose potato salad..... UGH, I went from bad to worse. This potato salad had a lot going on and all the ingredients over powered each other. I took only one bite of that and was done. I finished my sandwich and my hot link and got out of there. I'm not saying I won't have Honey Bears again, but I will definitely not be coming to this location. I'm hoping the location in central Phoenix has been better kept - restaurant and food.  PS don't go off most of the pictures posted on this page, and if you do, please check out the dates. they are as old as 2010 - and back then, this place was better. Not sure if personnel changed, owners, cooks, or what but it is not the same.

8WdHMeTa1tNBFlgAjplFFQ.text: Went in today with my friend. I must say for a joint which specializes in bbqs, the food was below standards.  I took the half pork ribs. Not only the sauce was bad but the meat was hard and not tasty at all. My friend who took the chicken sandwich with hotlinks was equally disappointed with the food. I'm done with this place and not visiting this again.

7N0S2UkUJKyLGndPwgY1JQ.text: No.. just no.   I had been to the location about 5 years ago.. I forgot why it had been so long. I don't believe the food was bad 5 years ago.  Well.. to start the Mac and cheese was so off base. It tasted almost like instant ( although I know it wasn't ) it had that generic made for the long day taste and generic feel to it. Certainly not a home style mix.   The ribs were under seasoned. cold. And seemed to be little meat on them. The collard greens lacked flavor and they were cold. And the bun was just sad. I was dumb founded about the sauce as it was very watered down and no kick to it.  On top of which the establishment gets a c in cleanliness! I don't know what happened....

fiVar6K8vOBs86B7ws8bHg.text: The ribs are well above average but their pulled pork sandwich is out of this world!   I've had BBQ from places all over the U.S. and this little place really stands out in my mind. :)  The reason I didn't give it five stars is for the location. It's not in a nice area but the staff is friendly and you can get your food to go.

ZVsrv47Xn6BbnnpZX3j1Sw.text: For a company that specializes in BBQ, their sauce is on par and very nice; however, that's the only great thing about this place. Much like others who have commented before, the ribs were tough and grizzly. They did my seem to have been slow cooked to perfection, more microwave for fast-good delivery.   Not a fan...

WknVrQ5GHq9OU-_sutSseg.text: Hands down the worst BBQ I have ever had. I ordered the brisket sandwich. The meat doesn't taste smoked at all. It has a high fatty content. It was served with the sauce already on it (not a wrong practice, but better to allow the customer to put the amount of sauce they are comfortable with), and the sauce was horrible. It was like aged ketchup. Also the bun was soggie half way through my meal due to the sauce and grease content. On top of that it was over $7 just for the sandwich. Why would I go back? I won't. Don't waste your money here unless they do some serious soul searching as to why they are in business. Obviously it is not what they are good at.  Alternatives are Dickeys, Ralph's, joe's real BBQ, or famous dave's.

YkIx-k4FZ3rCeWuKHpWUfQ.text: I've gone to Honey Bears now twice. First time was when I was a teenager with my grandparents. Was not impressed. Since it had been st least 15 years, I figured is give out another go. Honestly, I've made better bbq at home. For the price they charge you, of rather go to Famous Daves.   Pork was dry. Ribs were fatty. Cobbler was gluey and tasted like it was Comstock pie filling.   Thank goodness we ate using a Deal Chicken offer.

_tiKUyibzM9SJNNU5dNKXA.text: There's not much to say about Honey Bears BBQ...  The food is not as tasty as the smell I sense every early Saturday morning, & it lacks seasoning.  The location is a little sketchy, but is very clean inside the premises and the family staff are very polite.  Personally, the chicken is better than the ribs... But I only went there once & doubt it I will go back...

YRF5GRP8APw7wkif5806tg.text: Delicious Ribs and they have Big Red soda on fountain? what's not to love?!

S39GXv5PCe48fKXqgi9R4w.text: Honey Bear's is a place that was at one point a celebrated BBQ establishment, but it is now only a shell of its supposed former greatness.  The setup and quality are fast food, but the prices are a notch higher.  The meat tastes alright, but nothing special.  The restaurant itself is a bit of a dive (although the Central Ave. location is nicer, it is considerably more crowded).  The portions are meager.  All of this leaves you with the feeling that it would be a good $5 lunch.  Unfortunately, it's not just $5.

fJnbW1b6wQ1y3WrbnJBEfw.text: Had the 1/2 rack pork rib dinner.  Ribs, cowbrow beans and coleslaw.  All good to very good but not make a special trip for.    Tables, settings were minimalist but ok.  Rest room was probably less than miniamilst.  Will try other places if I am in the mood for barbecue.

DPR9ftibFEoCIlB3ksFkew.text: Amazing pulled pork sandwiches, great bbq sauce, best pork n beans ive ever had

kjb-wRmNL2H3uNVn5PfASw.text: I this is your idea of good BBQ, you obviously don't know anything about what good BBQ should taste like.  I saw one review that suggested you eat the meat with the sides - looking for flavor I guess.  Lame attempt at sauce, ho hum buns.  I think the only reason they've lasted is that this town doesn't seem to have much competition in the BBQ department.

_NmPWiHHBQIzddFmiAMvBg.text: I like the sauce here a little better than BBQ Company.  This is a little more vinegar while BBQ Co is sweeter.  The pulled pork sandwich at lunch is one of my favorites.

rAZrU7rrZLzlMx3BfaPOwA.text: I could see driving over from downtown for this.  Great, simple, tasty.  BBQ was best I've had outside of Oklahoma, and the cole slaw was very fresh (I'd go a bit less sweet, but it was nice and crunchy).

WcxL6XZkpyfYDtB3rOrZiA.text: I have been coming to this place and Haps for my bbq fixes for years. Since Haps moved to a building near Honeybears the flavors of their food have seem to drop to bland but Honeybears pork drowned with bbq sauce is really hard to beat. I have been to both the Central location and this one and even though people may say it is a dive they are fast and the food is always great. Their slider special is a good way to test the waters but make sure you drown it in sauce for extra goodness. The central location does fries and the Van Buren one does chips so a win for Central on that one.  Both have the tasty "Cowbro" beans which are quite good. The Central local also has vanilla pudding that is quite good but both may have and I never noticed. The downside to the central location is that they do get alot of business from all the offices near by so 12 noon there is a line. Last time I went I seen they were now selling their BBQ sauce so I grabbed a bottle of that also but have yet to try it.  I would recommend this place if you plan on a tasty quick meal with quick service.

SqjoTrW0dCxnNnsqchxDMA.text: I giggled and pulled over when I saw the advertisement. The slogan alone made the meal for me. The coleslaw and the pull pork BBQ sandwich was really good. My buddies ordered the ribs, they were huge and de-lish, from what they told me, its all good.

3rXhEPf_CDFkc4AJJuhHDA.text: I ordered the Chicken BBQ sandwich...was not that great. The chicken meat lacked any flavor. And the bread of the sandwich was extremely mushy. Plus, no sides and no kid options!! Just FYI...

p1UEb4q7YJSj0oapWcNhPA.text: Food here was great, I had a bad experience in tempe but this place was great!

NIszoi-MP5yjbUCgAopa1w.text: I feel bad giving them 2 stars, the first time I went I LOVED the bbq, so good, so tender.  Second time I went, same thing, BUT I got food poisoning!  A busy, well known place like that shouldn't have that happen.  I'm never eating there again.

W-XRs8dEDsT5YUslncoKeA.text: You want a big wad of sticky drippy animal on a bun? Well, you're in the right place. it sounds like the other location has more selection of sides. Why not here? This place is lacking. Bring me the home fries!! The sauce was too watery for me, but flavorful. I just wish it stuck to the meat better and didn't get soaked up by the bun. The potato salad was yummy (rather peppery), but I've had better.

YVH3cUMj4IvDf0_bAoIO1g.text: Above average BBQ at a resonable price.  Large portions.

nk4Fuau5wvGfpCvrM1Ukpw.text: Awful service.  Tried to place an order for pickup.  On hold while the lady was yelling at her kids.  I ordered potato salad but I was told it would take at least an hour before it would be ready.  I was told I could not pay with a credit card unless I called their catering department.  Could not get through to catering so I left a message.  Finally got a call back 35 minutes latter (she put me on hold because she needed to help a customer - I guess she did not consider me a customer!) and was told I should place my order a day in advance if I want to pay with a credit card,  In the end she hung up on me!  I felt so disrespected!  I will take my business else where and purchase from someone who wants my business!

ngzM33mRb4PFWPRRmzSY9Q.text: This place was recommended by the valet at another restaurant. It's just a hole in the wall that we'd have never chosen on our own but we were pleased with the quality and the reasonable price. We had brisket and pork. Both we tender and had good flavor without the bbq sauce. We had potato salad and Mac & Cheese for sides. The sides were larger than expected and were "homemade" quality. The Mac & cheese was super creamy and cheesy. The potato salad was a bit mustardy for my taste but was still good.

l7IvCHc5zcVsqs9t3Q1Mug.text: I believe this place is going on nearly 40 years. I met the owner. Most of the good places where I'm from (SC) are run my old black guys. This guy has the same roots.  Based on my two experiences Honey Bears gets one thing right... pulled pork BBQ... good thing that's all that matters to me. Could be considered best BBQ sandwich is greater PHX area. Grab one to or fro the airport. There is NOTHING else from this location for a couple miles.  *Save your money and avoid the sides. Hell, if you need more food, just get two sammies. Done.

8tpKPSQTJeNxIv86sbkqgw.text: I'm an Arizona native, but I lived in Memphis for a few years and developed a taste for Tennessee-style pulled pork. Honey Bear's is as close as you'll get, plus their sauce has a little southwestern kick due to all the chili flakes. Make sure to get the sweet potato pie!

bfdMikKrM48HmOb_E8l9mQ.text: Love this place. Their meats are cooked to perfection, the sauces are fantastic, and their sides are soooooo yummy. We come here a lot to get food to go, and have never been disappointed.

BZTMAL6BeVZZi9lz-BBeWg.text: I have eaten at Honey Bear's since they opened.  Back then the owner's where the cooks and family members worked the counter.  The rib tips on Fridays and the cocktails had the place packed.  Fast forward to today and a lot has changed in the kitchen and the counter.  I narrowed my selection to the pulled chicken, the pulled beef, and plenty of sauce.  I like the sliders on the menu but if you don't eat pork...check your order before you leave.  Ditch the bread and drench the meat with sauce and magic can happen!  I can't recommend any of the sides...but that's according to my taste...you may love them.

8RTTTPcaLfd59Y0T70DkVA.text: High Fructose Corn Syrup as the main ingredient in the sauce is my main issue. Why not use real sugar? First time customer and the Spanish speaking employees are difficult to understand and They would say yes to every question that I had about the menu. I guess the customer is always right! The Pound of Brisket was good. The pulled pork cup was good and greasy. The manager is cool and friendly.

qiOp64HRmu9_gc-abYS52g.text: Tried beef brisket sandwich. Came on a cold bun, with sauce. Enjoyed the beef, and sauce definitely a winner. Meat was chewy though, and could have been warmed up more. Mac and cheese average, needed salt.

R49QWypvHiwMYqhhkffkuA.text: This place isn't what it used to be.  I have fond memories of coming here as a kid and ordering fall-off-the-bone baby back ribs and delicious sides.  Coming here today, I was kinda disappointed. Not only to learn that they no longer serve babyback ribs and only serve spareribs now, but to learn that a good portion of them are overcooked or less tender. The corn has gotten bland, but the Mac and cheese was good. The only reason my review is 2 stars as opposed to 1 is the Mac and cheese.

yNyXNTYZXkprK2CvbDsMVQ.text: My favorite BBQ place in Phoenix.  Really like the sauce on the shredded Chicken sandwiches, but also like their Peach Cobbler.  Don't live close anymore, but used to go every couple of months to this and the other one that used to be in Tempe/Chandler area.

x8MX3-bdZzlLAoIiN2VfXg.text: I got the brisket sandwich combo with Mac and cheese.   The meat was awesome.   The sauce is a vinegar based aside which was okay but not my favorite.  I didn't care for the Mac and cheese.   My biggest complaint was the dining experience was ruined by the flies.   They are all over.   Landing on my table and my food and eventually my face too.   I would go back but but would probably get take out and a different side.

vU1tmv51wheKQ8s-SyxYQA.text: I just tried this place for my first time... HOLY COW I don't want this meal to end! I couldn't be happier with the beef brisket sandwich, Cowbro beans and Mac and cheese. Those cowbro beans tho..... everything exceeded my expectations! Although I got take out, the restaurant was very clean and nicely decorated. The man that helped me was very friendly!! My meal was ready in 10 minutes. Contemplating going back for seconds

sGgoMzLhVt770BJtysHHnA.text: I've been a Honey Bears customer for 30 years, but no more. I recently ordered nearly $200 worth of food for a party and they totally screwed up the order. That happens, right? But I called to complain, and also sent them an email, and I received no response. Beware bad customer service.

iVRUOo-eS0CszUAEoYa2Kw.text: I actually was pretty impressed with this place, the collared greens weren't impressive on this particular visit.  Last time, they were amazing but we went an hour before close (7pm) and they weren't cooked well, I'm sure it's usually better earlier. The rack of ribs was good as usual, friendly staff, Mac and cheese was alright..   I like the old fashioned style of Honey Bears, reminds me of the scenes in House of Cards where Frank goes to Freddies for ribs...that's why I like this place. I feel that the sweet potato pie should have been heated up but it tasted fine.  They serve beer. They serve cornbread and peach cobbler. Collared greens and cowbro's baked beans.   Major knock on what they should but don't offer: Sweet Tea... this is a southern place that has no sweet tea...so that was my only let down.

photos.caption: Photo of Honey Bear's BBQ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Rack a ribs, collared greens, and Mac and cheese.

tANgDCucXXaKIxU_M6SmLA.text: We ordered take-out from HB's. It's  been awhile since we've had their food, because it has not been that great In the past few years. So we foolishly decided to try it again.  We brought the food home and the first thing we pulled out of the bag was a foil - wrapped 1/2 ear of corn, ALREADY EATEN. Very GROSS!!! Everyone one said there was no way they would eat that food!!!  We took the whole order back to HB. No apology, no nothin'.   I am advising all to proceed with caution!  BTW, went to post this and they will not post unless I give a star rating. So giving a 1, but I would  like to make it a -10.

A_TXOWlsPyVysrYjBDhLgA.text: Wanted a great BBQ place but this is not the one. I spent $10 on dry pork sandwich, chips, and a soda. The pork was very dry and very little sauce in it. I would not go back.

VaAIFYNkY1WwXkslW4zmUg.text: I ordered a beef brisket sandwich with a side of Cowbro beans and collard greens for a total of $11.92(not including a drink) I had my own bottled water.  The first thing I found very tacky about this place is that I paid with my bank debit/credit card and the cashier system this place used is a swipe on a Airpad. Once swiped it's then turned around to me with an option to tip %15 %20 or %25 or decline. I just find this totally tacky that there's an option to tip the cashier or whoever it goes to for merely ringing up my order. (Just doesn't make sense to me but,seems to be a trend of putting customers on the spot to tip or donate) I find that irritating.  That was not the reason for my review of 2 stars. In reality I would give this place 2.5 stars. The food or at least what I ordered was well below average. I'll start with the sides. I know collard greens are probably not the most popular amongst folks but, I actually enjoy em and can tell good quality of greens. These were bland and seems undercooked. What made it worst is there is no hot sauce available for them. The cowbro beans were also bland. If you're lucky enough to have a few pieces of sausage in them it makes up for the blandness. The brisket was my main reason for the rating I give. It was dry and has no flavor on its own, I think that's why you must drown it with the house bar b q sauce. The bun it came with was cold and quick to become soggy or crumble. Overall this would not be a place to bring family or a friend that's craving BBQ

GYb41v1iP2h9yS09VP8ipw.text: Omg I'm at junk in the truck festival and just the smell drew me in!! And it tastes better then it smell! Definitely going back to the van Buern location!

6xmpr8N3l0z47ckEd1RvUA.text: I don't understand the lower reviews.   Admittedly, you are not here for the atmosphere. But the restaurant was clean and everyone was very nice.   My friend and I had the pulled pork sandwich and it was AMAZING!  Very smoky, not too sweet.  The sauce (which you can add yourself) was vinegary and smoky and just a little sweet.  Our other friend had the BBQ chicken breast.  Sides were also good. We had baked beans, mac and cheese, coleslaw.  I wish the menu was larger--rib tips and more dinner plate type options would've been good. But the food was excellent!

sQqJ3TOzPF_W35OMMGJ48g.text: OMGosh!!! Just had my fix of my favorite BBQ! Could just about drink that Tennessee/Carolina sauce. Lived next to this place back in '93 and realized again that I need to get there way more often! Mark even recognized me and hooked me up with some of the best Mac & Chez ever...as I was already getting the slaw and bro beans! Their sides are almost worth a trip there themselves. Next time a slice of that sweet potato pie is coming with me too  Thanks for all the years Mark...and to many more!!

n5L73-mkZpNqsggXrXLhug.text: 1st time visit and the food was great! My husband and I really enjoyed it. I had pulled pork and Mac and cheese. He had beef brisket and Mac and cheese. The flavor was awesome and the sause was sweet and spicy. I would go there again and recommend it to others.

QVlN2XbzhxI2umRQJLGIfw.text: As stated by other reviewers, Honey Bear's isn't what it used to be.   It's still tasty, but they seem to be giving you a whole lot less for a lot more money.  Add to that the screaming children they have running around lately.   The customer service is still very good.  There are better BBQ places than this.

flZKHOOWcDb9o45tp1sSRQ.text: Had bbq pork sandwich.  It was good, but over priced. No lids for your soda? Wth? Wish they served fries instead of potato chips.

gpbo-sgRVyFyBU1SV_qN9Q.text: Pick this place out of a hat while seeing a friend near by. Some of the best BBQ I have ever had!

_d2dP7Mg7w1jSfKicS6KoA.text: So good. One of the best tasting BBQ I have had in a long, long time.   Must try!!!!

OpDEgrZxpuGHzpxP3lfxXA.text: Wow, simply unbelievably good barbecue this far west!  The beans are the best this Texan ever tasted, meat and sauce both outstanding!

W2MZy1GSB5r0ge882KZNHg.text: I'm a long time fan of this Tennessee style 'que. In all fairness I'm fiercely loyal to the pulled pork and almost never have anything different. On the rare occasion I tried something else I enjoyed it, but I usually just do the half pound of meat w/ beans & slaw. It's honestly one of my favorite meals of all time. The Van Buren location is preferable.   This place is the real deal.

XlD7T86pcba3K2Y0Gwnhpw.text: I think it has started to go downhill a bit...then again phoenix is gaining more decent bbq places so I think that is part of why I just can't go any more.  Their is no smoke and not much flavor and the quality of the meat is not great. They get two stars due to a pretty decent bbq sauce and affordable pricing.

gi7PsZOKlKD_V2MJoy3bfA.text: Not real impressed.  Sauce wasn't all that and sliced beef was tough. Trash can was full, restaurant wasn't real clean. Two small sandwiches and two sides came to $20.   Won't be back.

qrMPmK8ku3ItoBSQRLVVYg.text: Looking for good BBQ?  Got a hankering for some tasty meats, slow roasted to perfection? Hop a flight to Austin Texas and head straight for 'The County Line' BBQ.   If you can't do that, the next best thing in Phoenix is Honey Bears. A long time establishment dedicated to satiating the appetites of carnivores everywhere.  Their motto is quaint and to the point;  "You don't need no teeths to eat our meat." Isn't that just precious? And so it goes, their motto has managed to attract the dentifrice-challenged from all over the valley, their smiles resembling jack-'o-lanterns.  Well I have all my 'teeths', which is precisely why I come here.  Being older, looks beginning to wane, I still have a nice set of choppers which excludes me from the dentifrice challenged category. It also makes me revered by other diners my age as a demi-god of sorts.    So whenever i'm feeling down, a little blue over how I never get the once-over from hot babes anymore, I come here,  where I'm worshipped by  toothless fucks from all over Phoenix, and all for little more than a lifetime of dental care! Go figure.  Their brisket. pork shoulder and chicken, all tasty, better than most BBQ joints in Phoenix.  Beans and coleslaw, nothing spectacular.  Service, friendly. Truly a good BBQ joint. Sauce is decent.  It's like eating at a homeless shelter, except the bbq is really good, and some half-assed preacher isn't in the dining area requiring you say a bunch of prayers in order to get a free meal.

FcIso7vKU3LjWPGz2YtbWw.text: I would give Honey Bears 3.5 stars if that were possible but it just wasn't quite 4 stars.  The ribs were delicious and my friends pork sandwich was better than expected and not over-sauced, which is usually the problem with bbq joints. But the service was slow and even though it wasn't very busy the staff just didn't seem like they were in a hurry to get us our food but were to busy talking to each other. We will give them another try though.

IJr7WigZwUk6jzUI-okgew.text: My favorite BBQ joint in phoenix.  I get the beef brisket every time.  FANTASTIC

e5qbwbXEAk9dFs23fvOmWg.text: So I will be the first to admit that I am not usually a big barbeque fan.  A few years ago I was in Kansas City and even then I was "Meh" about the whole thing.  Maybe my palate has expanded since then- who knows.  Either way, when I had a hankering for barbeque today it was a little unexpected to say the least.    To be fair, I had been meaning to try Honey Bears since I moved close to it.  I had heard how amazing it was, but just had never really been in the mood.  Today I gave in and went and I am so glad I did!  The service was nice and super fast.  I was really surprised by how quickly my food came out.  I ordered the 3 sliders, figuring I would have an assortment of tastes in case I picked the wrong thing.  All three were really good, but the pork slider was absolutely my favorite.  I don't normally like barbeque sauce, because it usually seems too sweet to me.  It seemed to me like there might be a little bit of a kick thrown in that kept it from being overly sweet.  The sauce paired with the tender juiciness of the pork was completely delectable.  Now I know what I will get when I get a barbeque craving (and this time it won't be a surprise!)

LzCwJ-ecJoawxaM1p2iTLQ.text: Got the pulled pork sandwich. The pork was good and so was the BBQ sauce. The bread was sub par. Macaroni was slightly undercooked and the cheese was a bit runny. The size of the pork sandwich was nice for the price. Next time, I'll just get meat by the lb.

3y7YkuSmUuPgQejxUPG1Eg.text: Went here Saturday after a long absence and was reminded why there has been such a long absence.  The food was mediocre and the facility is pretty run down.  I had the BBQ Pork, coleslaw and peach cobbler while my wife had the BBQ Pork and potato salad. We both thought the BBQ pork was a 3 or 4 on a scale of 1 to 10 and the coleslaw and potato salad were no better.  I was so looking forward to the peach cobbler but even it wasn't very good.   If you're in the area and want good BBQ go two minutes away to Hap's BBQ on Washington and 48th.  Of course Joe's BBQ in Gilbert is great too and even Famous Dave's kicks this place.

pani96g0GW98htg8zSNB9Q.text: Great BBQ.  The coleslaw was fantastic, and the pulled pork was quite tasty.  The sauce was also super good.   I would have gave 5 starts, but I did deduct one as the people who talk about the nasty bathroom here are totally right.  Bring your Purell if you wanna use the bathroom first.

Di8-9S2fQer7aoVjSEeOuQ.text: Good bbq and fast friendly service! This place had been around for ages and is easy to see why. Keep it up!!

zG4dBSRHxSBUzN2FyxyP2g.text: This place should not be in business! I thought this place looks like a dive, but the food COULD be really good.  The food was terrible.  I ordered 1 lb. each meat for take out.  The pulled pork, beef and chicken was rather dry and chewy.  The ribs were cold, dry, and very chewy.  I think the food has been stored too long and just reheated in the microwave.  Also, I asked if I could just order the ribs as meats by the pound for take out and no sides.  He said yes and then charged me the full dinner price and gave it to me without sides.  The sauce was this orange brown watery substance that I would not call BBQ sauce.  The final touch, is that their attitude and customer service is really BAD!

cNf3GyyKjye1H8KqY9Xocw.text: This is always been my favorite barbecue place in town, there pulled pork is really delicious.  There's always plenty of seating and nearby is the post office if you want to drop off your mail.  their side dishes always make me feel like I'm at home getting a homemade meal love their peach cobbler dessert. This place has a open container for sauce so you can get as much as extra bbq sauce as you like.

9SPLPGf28l19o2Ht_rraNQ.text: I've only been the their location on Central Ave.  When I went to order my usual I was informed that this location doesn't have french fries.  Ok bummer... I'll get along with it.  We went later in the evening and the place was really dead.  I'm sure at lunchtime its much busier.

R7O7WwlBnplc5jCb9RLfCw.text: We just went to Honey Bears it was after 11 and the sign said open at 11. We went in and the cook told us they were behind to give them another 20 mins or so. Not come in would you like a drink while you wait but nothing. Were we suppose to wait in our car til they opened so we left  as we were pulling out I took this picture. Boy if this isn't True just ask their cook!
