yeALCntOP3v_LNH_-wwTyg.text: This place is an awesome bbq place.  The sauces are great and the ribs are delicious.  All the side dishes are a winner.  This is always a must go to place every time I'm in Phoenix.

e5eBODfcC72qLmVo68231w.text: Please update your hours. Went in today and the hours said 10am - 8pm. Got there at 6:45 pm and no one was there. Miss this place.

izRDzF7IKAUs3hHlXIFuEQ.text: Place is ghetto and dirty. my combo comes with a drink and the cashier gives s red party cup as if I am going to a party or something then acts like it ok and does not even offer a discount.  it's a short middle aged woman with glasses. she is dumber then dirt offers no Information and talks if she has barely finished middle school.   The only reason. I even tried this place cause it's close to we're i live. I am.not a hater but people work hard for there money and I take great offense to being cheated out of money and a respectable amount of food that I purchased.   I sit and look at the two men that are owner and they laugh as they cheat people out of there money.  I petitioning for they place to be closed down if they are no changes being made and have called the health department for they food practices and unsanitary.   bottom line this place is garbage the owners are some cheap skate.crooks the workers there are garbarge.

U0fW24cSHySv3b-EvLwBrw.text: Tennessee BBQ done right, complete with a smoky and spicy bbq sauce. As much sauce as you want! I've been a loyal Honey Bears fan over the years, every time I'm in Phoenix, I'll end up here!  Get the pulled pork sandwich with beans and lots of sauce. Get the mac and cheese too. Put sauce on it. Use the yelp coupon, get your grub on.

photos.caption: Photo of Honey Bear's BBQ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pictures don&#39;t do it justice

Y5YpwsLTLHpIrLpLvl_ZQQ.text: It's ok, the meat is bland by itself. With the sauce it taste much better. I tried the pulled chicken and brisket sandwich. There meat by itself is no match for Rudy's.  Would I be willing to go back? Sure, since it's close by.

photos.caption: Photo of Honey Bear's BBQ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Brisket sandwich without BBQ sauce. By itself it is plain nothing special.

EifwFxtjSZ9SeDO0o2yxjg.text: 30 minutes after ordering after ordering A chicken sandwich through Grubhub, I showed up to find that my order hadn't even been started. I had to wait around another 10 minutes as the staff suspiciously regarded me as a hassle before I had a bag unceremoniously passed off to me. The bone and tendon in the meat must have been mixed into the sandwich so there was some semblance of texture since the chicken tasted as if it had been steam cooked in a dishwasher. Their ketchup and vinegar "BBQ sauce" added a particularly vile aspect to this meal. This wasn't my first experience here, but it will be my last.

ziCAeMvf9XXOgAlF9sxw_Q.text: They served me cold for and for the price it was NO good I would never go there ever again what a waste of money

aiRDM6PgrCj0dV4oyXjT4w.text: Placed order 2 hours ago and now they tell me they are out of pork. Not the Honey Bears I once knew.

DjaoyLmyp7ksxrboZYLJqQ.text: We came in on a Saturday and were standing around waiting to be served for an awkward amount of time. Then when we finally were ready to order they didn't have anything we wanted. They just said "we don't have that". A BBQ place without brisket on a Saturday night? The food itself wasn't great either. Choose a different BBQ spot.

-Y9aidnHL18oEUu4jJQcxw.text: I heard through the grapevine (and Yelp) that Honey Bear's BBQ was a great place to go for authentic BBQ in the area, so I took some friends from Italy to try their first BBQ and we were not disappointed. The amount of meat on the ribs was the most I've ever seen, so they clearly have a great butcher connection. The sauce was not too heavy nor sweet nor spicy, the coleslaw was perfect and the corn was extremely soft. My rib meat was not falling off the bone, but it was tender.  We'll definitely be back!  There's plenty of room for wheelchair/powerchairs, though the gravely parking lot is a bit awkward.

photos.caption: Photo of Honey Bear's BBQ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Half ribs, coleslaw and corn sides

ExBt9e6CnJQgWBZT0v_E7A.text: I don't know what I just ate... but it sure as hell wasn't Tennessee BBQ.  Let me start this off by saying: I moved to Phoenix from North Carolina, and I was born in Louisiana - so my bar for BBQ, Southern, and soul food is admittedly very high.  So far 9/10 attempts to find good Southern food here have failed... and this was one of those failures.  It's not my aim to be mean, and I know this is a family business - but dammit, I get offended when I eat stuff like this parading under the guise of Southern food. I think it's misleading to people who've never had the chance to taste the real stuff.  I'd say: don't eat here... but it's a local family business and I'm not a jerk. Honestly - they just need to hire a pit master from Tennessee or North Carolina who knows wtf is up and let them do their thing. It's never too late to reassess and improve.  To be more specific: Cons  Brisket on my sandwich was a wet slop, almost like a pot roast and flavor was off. Sauce was weird and didn't blend well with the meat. Potato salad was in a word - bizarre! Not sure what I was tasting in there - but there was too much of it and it overpowered everything. Greens were bland as hell, and a little rubbery. Also... put out some hot sauce! What kind of BBQ joint doesn't have at least 2-3 different types of hot sauce! And salt! The woman working the counter... wow. Really odd demeanor, like she's half asleep. Not very friendly and I watched her clean the same table for 15 minutes. Didn't bring our food out... just nodded at the counter and said "yours is over there". When we asked for hot sauce, she just seemed confused... which in turn was confusing... because... BBQ?!  Pros Mac n cheese was good!  They have RC cola and Big Red on tap! Classic.  Cute place  Friendly owner

Bhm-AmIan5iQsmJ7nW6fuQ.text: The establishment is dirty and run down. Paint peeling, dirty floors, dirty window sills and windows and broken unsanitary bathroom. Makes me question the cleanliness back in the kitchen and their safety with food prep. The "meal", which they refer to as a "plate" was expensive and didn't even come with a beverage. They are charging an outrageous $2.89 for a fountain drink. The pulled pork sandwich was good but not great and certainly not worth (in my opinion) the price they are charging.

photos.caption: Photo of Honey Bear's BBQ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. I&#39;ve had better

HGa08LvzjLavJoYlczqYjQ.text: The chicken barbeque sandwich is tasty. Their side dishes and lemonade is good and the service is fast. The place is on the plain side but they serve you clean tables and away you go. Will come back.

7hZdoT5NQq1Ublz-kVI3CA.text: It's a solid choice for good BBQ.  I had lunch here and brought home the chicken and rib platter for dinner. The staff is a little generic, but the point here is obviously all about the food.  It doesn't disappoint but the portion size is a little light for the cost, especially since they surely don't pay very much for rent.  I stop by whenever I'm in this side of town and it is definitely recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Honey Bear's BBQ - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Honey Bear's BBQ - Phoenix, AZ, United States

00Sf_Wv0T26EjmvNRS7ySA.text: Average BBQ joint. I had a pulled pork sandwich combo with coleslaw. The meat tasted good, but it lacked a Smokey flavor and almost seemed like it may have been cooked in a crock pot. Sauce was okay, not sure if it's made in house or not. I think I'll try the location on central before eating here again.

seu1rBGIb5AgtV-n2Elm4Q.text: Friendly service. Terrible location. The ribs & chicken combo with 2 extra sides was enough for us two ladies to make two full meals out of. My favorite sides were the Mac and Cheese, and the potato salad. Collard greens didn't have a ton of flavor & the cobbler was more bread pudding texture. The flavor of the bbq sauce makes up fo my negative feedback, we will definitely be returning to Honey Bears BBQ.

8vtdJIbhRfWpqHah2gNZmw.text: How many ways can you spell DISAPPOINTED!!!!! I have had better BBQ on a HUNGRY MAN DINNER.   I had a friend in from Chicago this evening who was staying at the ALOFT by the airport. I wanted to impress him with the BBQ at HB's as he has taken me to some really great places in Chicago. This HB's was the first one I had eaten at when I first arrived in PHX. I last ate here 2 years ago when I was on Van Buren and the food was great!!!! What Happened???  We arrived at about 7:45. When we walked in both men were texting on their cell phones and did not really seem to care much about anything else. The person working the counter a tall man of ethnic origin was kind of aloof and on the rude side. I got the BBQ Chicken and my guest got the BBQ Pulled Pork. Total Cost: $19.63 which BTW was a great year. The food was out in 5 minutes so you know a lot of care was taken in the cooking and preparation. The Chicken did not taste fresh. It was soft and moist like it should be but it tasted like a reheat from 2 days past. Presentation was HORRIBLE! My friends pulled pork sandwich was served on a white hamburger bun and the sauce saturated it so much that he could not hold it to eat it. The bun should have at least been toasted.  I was extremely embarrassed as my friend threw more than half of it away.  In the not so distant past I ate at the Honey Bears on Elliot and Priest.  It is close to my home and the food was consistently good and we went every other month. I guess every chain has a BRONZE store and I guess HB's on 5012 E Van Buren St Phoenix, AZ 85008 is the B@$T@RD child of the chain.  My advice....try someplace else where they want your business and serve FRESH food.  I am Jeff and I call em as I see em!  BTW if you are handicapped they have a ramp but the parking lot is so uneven and has course asphalt, it is a major trip/fall hazard.

photos.caption: Photo of Honey Bear's BBQ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. That is the end of the leg. Mmmmm Good. I have seen better looking skin on the legs of a 90 y.o. woman
Photo of Honey Bear's BBQ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Look at the care that was taken in the presentation of my meal. Isn&#39;t it appetizing? All this food for $9.95. Is this really a 1/2 chicken?
Photo of Honey Bear's BBQ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Our Bill

0HHtiw2AauOlDvqPDs16wA.text: What has happened to the sauce? It does not taste the same not only that it's put in an old apple cider container. It used to serve it in containers with their name on it. Service is definitely lacking on both stores Central and Van Buren. we have been going for years and with the exception of one time had excellent service but the last 2 times once at Central and now at Van Buren service is just above rude.   I really miss the old sauce and service with a smile.

olHptzpAutkkLxXXPNNhjQ.text: Honestly I am shocked to read some of the more tepid reviews on here -- no offense, but I wonder if they ate at the same place we did?  This place was excellent.   My husband and I both think we are individual experts at BBQ.  He travels all over the country and tries the ribs everyplace he visits -- whoopee.  Meanwhile, I grew up in Memphis, attending the Memphis in May cook off every year and visiting award winning BBQ joints the other eleven months.  Whichever one of us is right about their superior knowledge of BBQ (clearly I am) we both LOVED the food here.  This is without doubt, as close as I've come since I left Tennessee.  The pulled pork is smoky and so tender it melts. The Cole slaw was on point -- and pulled pork ain't Memphis style without coleslaw right on the sandwich.  The sauce is sweet and tangy and fantastic.    The ribs were smokey and tender.  They were so good without sauce that it was a personal struggle deciding to dip or not dip each bite of rib meat.  Don't go in expecting a fancy dining room and table clothes with this five star experience.  However, if you're looking for really authentic BBQ, this place is the bomb.

RKeujJZWg-t90RSb9H9ZPw.text: Yet another great hole in the wall joint. They have awesome pulled pork sandwiches. This place is a local classic.

d9gSsBFLCcf8rIthYk4i6Q.text: Slogan: "you don't need no teeth to eat our meat"...  Actually, yeah, you really do. I gotta respect honey bears for becoming somewhat of an icon in the valley, but the pulled pork leaves a little room for improvement. My opinion is that it's cooked at too high of a temp. (note to honeybear: aim for 225 degrees - get staff in earlier if necessary)  Too high temp results in not enough time in it's early cooking stages to absorb that smoke flavor, which is also evidenced by an absence of color.   Slower cook time will also take some of the bite out of the meat.  But hey, it seems to be selling, so why change?  Maybe they should change the slogan though.  It is tasty, but all of the pork sandwich's flavor comes from the sauce, which is pretty unique - give me 100 sauces and i guarantee i can pick out honeybears.

IKpepCy8T7YFyuVkfMZ4Jg.text: Great sliders! Amazing BBQ sauce. I was disappointed when I was there because they were out of sweet potato tater tots, but I hope the next time I go they will be in stock! :)

pktXW_XOo0j65Za_-tYkug.text: This is a great BBQ place, known for their sauce but their beans are fantastic (i get those over their sandwiches) and 2 for 1 beers everyday.   If your uppity maybe not the place for your but if you don't care what a place looks like as long as it has great food check it out.

5jjjFIh71sRT809o-XG10g.text: Great old school restaurant, great BBQ, best sauce. Scottsdale folk stay away it has a dive feel to it.

Yx6TYIpAvBnQqFYCRFr8aQ.text: A coworker of mine RAVES about this place so when they came up on Groupon I jumped on it. It timed out perfectly to be the place where I had my goodbye lunch for my last week at work. I have to say, I was not dissappointed. I had the pulled pork and the beans and it was delicious. The portions were perfect for me, I left completely full but not uncomfortable. It was a great lunch but I can't say it was the best barbeque I ever had which is the only reason I didn't give it 5 stars.

Ccp8gFFJBRwhcfrOwCDBaA.text: I went here on a Groupon, and my initial thought was "I'm glad I only paid 50%." The ribs were too fatty and in small pieces (like bony riblets). It was heavily sauced, so I have no idea if it was properly smoked. The atmosphere was okay but is far from the best in the Valley. The highlight was their Mac & Cheese. Oh, and RC Cola? Seriously?

wqPKei7GEi1hArVpmHXD2g.text: Okay, totally ecstatic about the Big Red! And the pulled pork, was juicy, tender and just down right good.The mac and cheese wasn't too cheesy but it had a nice pepper season to it... it was delicious. Because we got our order to go they put the sauce on the side so we can pour it on to our liking. I use the whole of sauce. It's sweet but with a spicy lil kick/aftertaste. I know of very few BBQ spots that have left a positive taste in my mouth and this is one for future reference to hit up if I'm looking for a good hole in the wall BBQ spot.

KyqSerJO6JxAq3BYc9Lbsw.text: Great pulled pork sandwiches and it's a quick 5 min. drive from my house.  If you like BBQ this is one of the better places here in AZ.  I don't think their sides are really that good more just there to have something on the side other than the sandwich.  Anyways as I said great for a quick bite.

mwzRwY1QaaexKH36JX-Vgw.text: Very good BBQ joint.  Cheap and no frills, just like it should be.  Maybe I'm just lucky, but I have yet to be disappointed by Scottsdale cuisine!

uMIXMtIbT5CfP7IE86CKdg.text: Best BBQ I've had this side of the Mississippi river. They also cater sporting events and concerts. They had a big tent set up at the Mesa amphitheater for a blues concert and they didn't gouge you for a sandwich and drink like most venues will.

7GGC4PMvL0B37QQP6Gg4fw.text: I used to love Honey Bears, but in the past 24 months, for some reason, they've lost their soul.   And that's bad because this was the only reliable selection of BBQ in Arizona.  Whatever they changed, and I'm not sure it's quantifiable, but it needs to change back.  Whenever I'd fly into the PHX airport around dinnertime, I'd bring home some Honeybear's for me and the wife.  The last few times, it's just been kind of "meh".    I'm not quite sure what it is, but I need to find a new guilty pleasure, smothered in BBQ sauce.

Ar7GDRAwZ5oTYfbv4JQKIA.text: "The 1st warning sign should have been the lack of bbq smell when entering in the parking lot. Someone in the group mentioned that they must smoke the ribs at a different location. The servings are huge, but the food was disappointing. I'm used to great flavor without the bbq sauce and meat that falls off the bone. Here, if you didn't have sauce, you did't have flavor. I think they boil their ribs then grill them. The corn on the cobb was waaayy over cooked and water spewed down my arm after every bite. I've had better!"

lyM8VC3fZ9MxTutHAZteIA.text: I don't really know why but i expected to not quite enjoy Honey Bear's BBQ. Most of that is because when i think of BBQ anything i don't think of buying it more someone outside cooking it for me. Yet when i went in I can say I enjoyed. I ate the shredded chicken sandwich and was super happy with it. Though not a go to place if i get the craving I will pop back in again.

PFUpov8mZoF-z_-C4KDiPA.text: They advertise "you don't need no teeth to eat our meat." Well, yes you do! I bought a full rack of baby backs and couldn't wait to get home with them. They were VERY tough... and had very little meat on them.

03kSYCUhm6L4ckUydOOjRg.text: 3 of us went there each had a regular sandwich, combo 1,  which was GROSS.  The bottom bun appeared to be dipped in the meat juices prior to the meat being placed on top.  The meat did taste good if eaten with a fork and all bread products were avoided.  Coleslaw was only tolerable, to soupy and peppery.  What happened here?

L113fBdbA91qhtPs2d9DOQ.text: ahhh, honey bear's.  i'm not sure where the name comes from, but i am sure the food is DARN GOOD.  the meat is ridiculously tender.  the sauce is good, runny, but good.  somehow i end up consuming a couple tubs of it without realizing.  the proportions aren't very big, for the sandwiches or the sides, but i guess you can argue that it helps you to not over-eat.  prices are pretty fair though. and again, the taste...mmm...  they cater too, which is pretty amazing when you show up somewhere and it's buffet honey bear's time!

SLhOlFWOuo8e3p5Dak8Evg.text: Now I hold all my BBQ reviews up to my favorite standard and that is Rudy's (a TX based chain with stores in ABQ).  Now I have only been here (Honey Bear's) once on a suggestion from a friend who said it was as good as Rudy's.  Well now I can't say that just yet.    I stopped in on a whim for lunch.  I decided on the pulled pork sandwich and a side of mac n cheese.  I added a few jalapenos, but I could have used some fresh onions (I guess I should have asked).    The mac n cheese was good and creamy (velveta like in texture)  and the bbq sauce thin but very tasty (not to sweet, not too ketsupy or vinegary and a nice kick).  The sandwich was that type that required some fork and knife work, especially if you are like me and add more sauce.    As for the restaurant itself, when I was there it was clean, no frills cafe style.  You go up to the counter to order and pick-up and find a spot to sit.  I enjoyed my meal and plan on going back to try more items off the menu.

Ta7GLeWF0dlxQK5bSx3J4g.text: This seems to be a more "authentic" location than some of the Honey Bear's I've been to, but it did not add much to the experience. The aisle that feeds you to the counter is winding, obtrusive and unnecessary. I ordered the large BBQ Beef sandwich, potato salad and a large RC cola to go. After a bit, the guy working the counter called my number and handed me a tray. I politely asked him to make it to go, and got a bit of attitude. Once I got back to the pad, the food was soggy and hard to eat, but that was kinda a good thing. It was actually refreshing to have an RC, it seems like you have to go with either Pepsi or Coke all the time. I would go back. There is something about the sauce that will bring me back in eventually. Not the kind of place I think I'd frequent, but good in a pinch.

LffgGx7H_8NJoCzupqsVHw.text: Great food, always consistent. Prices fair, service spotty but acceptable. I visit about every 8 weeks and look forward to getting my q on

Bxd5CUWA6CEVANEQ9bTnpg.text: I've been going to Honey Bear's for years and have never experienced customer service this bad in all that time.  I went to order food for a meeting and it was very early (about 10:30 or so).  I had to wait a few minutes for anyone to acknowledge me at all.  Once I started ordering for multiple people (all on one check) the girl looked at me like I was completely stupid.  I had to repeat my order multiple times and she still got it wrong, all the while, looking at me like I was an idiot.  I noticed that she only put down 1 sausage link plate instead of 2 and asked her to add the other one.  She had such a major attitude when I asked for the link platter and she told me they didn't have that available at the time.  How hard is it to just not put the links on a bun and put them on a plate instead? I get the food and there is barely any BBQ sauce.  I ordered for 8 people, and was only given two small containers of sauce.  She gave me a hard time when I asked for more, and that was also when I found out I got two sausage link sandwiches instead of platters.  I also asked for the spicy BBQ sauce and was told (with lots of demeaning attitude) that the sauce wasn't ready yet. (really???) Long story longer, if the owners or the family is anywhere in the building, I'm sure the customer service would be better.  The food is pretty great, but not good enough for me to go back anytime soon.  It's too bad because I work for a company that loves to order from Honey Bears for meetings, but after the experience I had, I definitely won't be ordering from them any time soon!!

c0brgydGfAn7qHU-s8jbAw.text: This is pretty good BBQ.  Not the best I have had but not the worst.  The sauce is yummy but the meat couldn't stand alone.  They seem to rely heavily on their sauce to carry the food.    The Mac and Cheese was average...better than Kraft but I have had better out of a grocery store deli.    I almost had to give them an extra star for their catchy slogan ("You don't need no teeth to eat our meat") but didn't because that would just be a silly thing for me to do.

RP-_oPQNqH8rEOV39z5jIg.text: Something is up at the Tempe Honey Bears, and it's not good.  I've eaten here for years, and at their Phoenix location, and previously at their South Tempe location (now closed). Food and service have always been excellent.  On my last visit, the place does not appear to be run by the family who has delivered excellent food and service for the past several decades. I ordered my usual Rib & Chicken combo with 2 sides.  The chicken was OK, but the ribs were seriously undercooked and underseasoned.  This was a huge disappointment!  As with most BBQ places, the ribs are supposed to be, juicy, flavorful and fall-off-the-bone tender.  It's something I look forward to when indulging at a place like this.  The hispanic staff (including a very young kid) who were running the place were unfriendly and slow.  There are lots of BBQ joints in town now, several closer to home, but I've been a loyal fan of Honey Bears for a long time.  I hope they can get their act back together.

d5q07y0Jj0FUofcQiYbuaw.text: My dad used to have this saying.  "If you put it on top of your head your tongue would beat your brains out trying to get to it".  That sums up how i feel about honey bears.  After living in St Louis for a while i feared i would never find BBQ that met my standards ever again.  But this place is probably the best in the valley.  Many places try, but none can match this place for the portions or the price.  Only reason they didnt get 5 stars is the lack of cornbread.  What is with BBQ places here and no freakin cornbread?  Blasphemy. But other than that, perfection.

1jWJcPUPYadz1W3S7zMKIw.text: The Real Deal  I'm from East Tennessee and our BBQ is North Carolina style. After moving out to Tempe in '95 I thought I'd never see good BBQ but Honey Bear's changed that, they could hold their own in the South. Honey Bears is N Carolina -style BBQ and the real deal., not cooked with spice/sauce until you put it on the meat. Go for the Pork! this is what they do, skip the beef and chicken, it's for the BBQ illiterate. Same with the folks who complained about having to put the sauce to the meat or not having fries, you do not know Southern BBQ. For those who do, enjoy!

mdHwfQP0v08etv_TQl4Gsw.text: Real BBQ smoked in a smoker.  Tangy and tasty sauce.  I speak on the one on V an Buren which I've been going to since the 1970's.  Their beans and potato salad are out of this world.  Always try to go to mom and pop joints as opposed to chains.  That's worked out well over the years in the Phoenix area.

agFiZ49qXpzcH4R2hOk0OA.text: Delicious! Ribs, chicken, mac and cheese! It's all so good!

EkMdTsaEHbv5CunK6Zso3g.text: This was a pretty decent place for good BBQ.  There isn't that much variety - mostly focused on BBQ meat sandwiches.  The good thing is that despite the small menu, what they do have is pretty good - I had the BBQ beef, which was tasty and had a ton of flavor.

FY2IDHz5GA-nbSYMuf8nFw.text: We really liked this place. Tried them on a Groupon and will definitely be back when we come in town. The outside of the place looked a bit scary, but don't let that fool you. It was excellent food! We had the ribs, wonderful, fall of the bone delish! The chicken was just as juicy! The pulled BBQ beef was good too. Potato salad was great too! This is definitely in the top 5 BBQ places we've ever eaten at. Enjoy!

Kb9kTZEb2uOkXYstOQhiCg.text: Honey Bears is an experience.  I don't want to see how clean their kitchen is(n't), use the restroom or walk to my car in the dark alone, but I CAN'T GET ENOUGH!!!  It is the best BBQ around hands down!  I LOVE the pulled pork sandwich and would eat anything drenched in their bbq sauce.  Its sweet and spicy with the perfect touch of vinegar-i-ness.  You definitely need quite a few of the paper napkins to clean up with afterwards.  Actually, just take a shower.    Their beans, coleslaw and peach cobbler are delicious too.  They also cater.  Its a dive, but TOTALLY worth the trip!

279zAQU6g4JJZ8yh1ia-RA.text: Honey Bears is a place I'd heard fantastic things about for quite some time and so when I finally made it over there one weeknight with some friends and office-mates, I was surprised to find it so incredibly lackluster.   More than that, it was simply not good. I'm not sure if the food was just old and done for the day, as we were there about an hour before closing time, or what, but the meat was basically sprayed with some sauce and they called it a day. The meat was devoid of flavor and overcooked. I had chicken but the ribs were absolutely nothing to sneeze at either. The corn on the cob was simply some frozen piece nuked up or boiled or what-have-you, with some chips thrown in for good measure and that was about it.  The insides aren't impressive in the slightest, either. I've been to plenty of dive places and had a great dining experience and considered it more the fun for it (Lolo's original location in Phoenix comes to mind, as it has a certain fun and well-managed charm inside) but this was dark, dingy, and unpleasant.  The sauce was perhaps a saving grace if the food wasn't served nearly lukewarm and was able to bring something to the table on its own. Sadly, no amount of sauce-drowning could save my meal. I left unhappy and unfulfilled. I've heard so many great things from people I trust, so I may have to try it once more, during the day, but for now, the one star stands, as there was simply nothing even a little redeeming about this food.

CUTKlCKTMbsrJC_EFp5JkA.text: The first time I went here, I was living at some apartments just down the road at Papago park.  I had only lived in Phoenix a couple years and where I come from there wasnt much in the way of BBQ so I didnt know anything about it other than I've had ribs before.    I walked up to the counter and a very large black man hears me say "Uhh, I'd like to get a rack of beef ribs please".   He barks back "Boy, you dont want no beef ribs.  What you want is pork ribs" Being the skinny half Korean kid I was, all I could say was "Yes sir"  I'll tell ya, that changed my life.  Pork ribs, especially the ones from Honey Bear, make beef ribs taste like a McDonalds McRib sandwich.

9j94hAulFqqE2sHuEl_ALw.text: Great place for pulled pork BBQ sandwiches! Awesome beans and coleslaw to go with your meal. Just enough to fill you up and make you happy at lunch time. They also have Big Red! If you're in the area, also look for Hap's Pit Barbecue and you can compare both places, see which one you like better!

photos.caption: Photo of Honey Bear's BBQ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The perfect little lunch meal!

6iJa7MzR3gchySAOeUvHQA.text: ribs were dry, hardly any meat on them, and chewy/tough. seems that management may have changed since I last visited many years ago. man at counter lacked appreciation for my business, made crude comments about women who had just left,  and was very impersonal, did not thank me for my business or even look at me when he handed my to go order to me. I doubt I'll ever return to this location. the one on central I may try once more.

photos.caption: Photo of Honey Bear's BBQ - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ZgsVfIdO9izDtmBbBc9Jmg.text: I have eaten here for years and like the beef and chicken sandwiches but over the years they have stopped trimming most the fat off the beef and that makes it pretty gross. The reason I don't eat here much anymore is your order from the counter from some kids with no personality, have to come to the counter to get your food, go to a station to get sauce, another for plastic ware and napkins and they have a TIP JAR at the counter.  Are you serious? The urinal in the bathroom has been broken for years with a trash bag over it so no one pees in it.

GWR2TdvYv5Jbya7bOiiBZg.text: Cannot believe I have lived next to this place for years and never tried it! Went for lunch today and the sliders (one pork, one beef and one chicken) were AMAZING! Their mac n cheese was bomb too, not to mention the Big Red. Will definitely start eating here regularly.

k82UP2CLaKcKD5yPdV1tQw.text: Must have been an off day but still pretty good. Better luck next time!

ugEmq438EMUbURKXtPvfrA.text: I was taken to Honey Bears BBQ by a co-worker for lunch and oh am I glad I learned about this place! We went this location by the airport, but I imagine they are all just as tasty. I got the 3 slider plate with a side of macaroni and cheese. We got it to go and the sauce (a very large portion) comes on the side. YUM! I'm a smaller girl but I can eat and this lasted me lunch and dinner - the leftovers were just as amazing. Can't wait to go back! :)

pLalLgsLOCMCsVpIvt1PNg.text: Their sandwiches are excellent! I like to get the slider trio with bbq chicken, brisket, and pulled pork. Their potato salad is pretty decent but not as good as grandma's ;). Also, their coleslaw is quite nice but just a touch of too much mayo. Now comes the bad part: the ribs. I absolutely love bbq ribs and unfortunately their's were dry with very little meat on the bone. I would not recommend the ribs here to anyone. Stick with the sammy's and you'll be all good.

RkDUD5Em3FA3Hz_l0mtObA.text: One of the best BBQ beef sandwiches I've ever had. No fuss barbecue and quite the experience. Oh, and the cowboy beans are amazing too.

eHnv1uNmXT1OCEmBt0Pkcw.text: Ordered two BBQ Cups of Chicken for $10.00 each and for $10 each you would think these would be the best "cups of chicken" you ever had? Not even close the size was less than a half a cup. Had barely any BBQ sauce on it and the bottom was filled with water. I started to eat it until my friend said stop mine is pink. I brought it back to the girl and she said the pink was BBQ sauce and the water was "juice" she offered to replace them, at this point I was gagging and said no thanks hoping she would offer a refund or at least an apology. I left them on the counter with disappointment. I will never eat from that place again. They should teach their employees what good customer service is. Waste of money.

8y9-WplEXGBv8EKItz9KTQ.text: This place is an icon in Phoenix. It's been around for as long as I can remember and with good reason. They are simply the best at classic style Southern BBQ. The meats are always consistent and juicy with exactly the flavor I expect. The sauces are also delicious. Well worth the trip any day of the week.

ybH7SiCrLLQal1pYv96ODQ.text: Very casual dine-in experience. I wouldn't go for the "vibe," per say, because they're really famous for their catering! Cheap canned and bottled beer and some of the best bbq in Phoenix for sure.

6bE47d7kYc7sCoer2hVFSQ.text: I found this place to be far inferior to both other BBQ joints and other restaurants in general. My family and I decided to meet up with my parents here before taking my daughter to see Zoo lights at the Phoenix Zoo. It was a poor choice.  To start the staff was unfriendly. The gentleman taking the order had a question for my step mother and instead of politely asking my father (who was ordering) he just yelled over his head to her in an offstandish tone. When my wife and I went to order he just walked off. A woman with a blank look cane out and just started at us until we ordered. Really bad first impressions.   The food didn't help improve their standings. I ordered the brisket sandwich with fries and coke slaw, my wife ordered the pulled pork sandwich with fries and corn. She was told it would be a bit for the corn to be ready.   I can't speak about the issues with my parents order (they just said it was unpleasant) ours was ccoolldd, bland and soggy. The buns weren't toasted so the liquid from the meat turned them to tasteless mush. My coleslaw was unimpressive and the fries were way too salty. The "freshly made" corn was cold and overcooked. While the fries were oversalted, the corn had none. None of the tables had any shalt shakers, not were there any packets available. When I asked for some I got this is look and then the woman behind the counter have me a plate of salt. Odd. No amount of plate salt could save the bland BBQ. While there was a solid smokey flavor, that was it. The meat wasn't seasoned and sightly acrid.   Blech, waste of $30. Never coming back.

RA8k4yKgD6c7yxagyYiPig.text: So disappointed. Mac 'n cheese was one big clump of goo. Meat was too fatty.  Good smoke flavor and sauce.

PVGfz9qFcWE_vncyUd40tQ.text: The worst food we had in a long time. Service was not friendly, soda machine didn't work at all.  My husband had potato salad and only took two bites and said it had a funny taste.  I had the brisket sandwich , he had the pulled pork , we couldn't tell the difference. Need up eating what meat there was and not the bread. As there was more nun than meat. Only plus in my meal was the collard greens, they were good. One thing I can't stand is employee's taking about other employees and that what we listen to, as an employee was sitting right behind us. Our friend said try it . Not sure about our friend. Why we didn't just take the food back up and tell them we wanted our money back , was a mistake.

BNYeAPqb0Rie9zViLRTBUQ.text: We used to go to Honey Bear's years ago and decided to take out for our weekly family lunch today. I don't know what happened to the food, but 5 meals for $130 is downright highway robbery, especially for what you get. We got 5 Rib & Chicken Combos. The chicken was decent, but the meat was blah. All of the flavor came from the BBQ sauce. And the ribs were overcooked or BBQ'd (I wish I had take a photo) with not much meat. Some were definitely burned black but slathered in BBQ sauce to cover it. We were very disappointed and won't return. Way Overpriced for mediocre food.

WoWzX3jU8M9TSiZtjITf3Q.text: Worst place to order food from. How do you open up at 10:30 but don't have all the items on your menu readily available to order form.  If you open up at 10:30 and you know you have to make the food shouldn't you be in the kitchen at least an hour before opening. Always a disappointment when coming here.

cRhnUMemSo_AJTp1UOan_g.text: I've come to this location for years and have watched the slow decline in this establishment.  The food quality is declining, its dirty, and the staff isn't friendly.  The soda fountain is constantly broken or out of something.  The drink station is nasty.  The restroom is barely serviceable.  This will likely be my last time eating at either of the Honey Bear's locations.  So disappointing to watch it fail.  Also, the price is indicated as one $, but is notably more expensive at over 12 dollars for a combo meal.

eVhQKr_knPJPdHHlkUEirw.text: Everytime I bring home Honey Bears my whole family is happy. Great food! If you like BBQ it doesn't get better than Honey Bears.

nDkG80A5qKf3OAns4ZS_CA.text: A friend of mine could be to Honey Bear's BBQ recently and it was some of the best barbecue I've had in a long long time. Looking forward to going back

FfCjaDayxPR3Gy_dpRnjJg.text: Food was amazing and was ready within 5 minutes of my order. Lady at the counter was extremely nice and inured a out way to make a 2 meat plate out of a sandwich (no bun) without ordering by the pound. Will definitely be back when I'm in the area.

lmekW41pitMkGFwd69_pmg.text: This place SUCKS!!!!! The kitchen is in complete chaos! I ordered a 2 piece catfish dinner for $11.99 and a beef brisket sandwich for $6.99 for a total of $20 and change. Waited 20 minutes until order was done. Got to my car realized my beef brisket was not in the bag. Went back inside waited another 15 minutes for a simple sandwich.  Got home and opened boxes and the 2 piece catfish dinner is one fillet cut in half to make 2 pieces... BS! Mac and cheese had NO cheese... lame.... beef sandwich bottom bun was completely Soggy.....Will NOT be going back.....Stay away from this stupid ripoff place....

jRmVtQ7Tbko-YREsVC_xtQ.text: The food is good.  The coleslaw is really good.  I recommend never using a credit card.  At the Van Buren location... they always run it twice and it double charges sometimes.  I called them them when I saw my bank ledger to fix it and their customer service was atrocious.  I will never eat there again personally.  That's just out of self respect.  It's sad.  I've eaten there since they opened and were donating all their proceeds to their church.  I wish them the best.  I'll find another place to go for BBQ

MMWsGp54Qgy3Y-HcKia2JQ.text: Wonderful place with fantastic food and friendly staff. The BBQ is unparalleled and you really feel like you got quality home cooking when you come to Honey Bear's BBQ. Can't wait for my next visit.   Thank you Honey Bear's BBQ!!

jOLtydHfJ6e1lF4guQmoFA.text: My best friend and I were in a tough spot a few months ago when we stumbled upon Honey Bears BBQ. Long story short we were stranded on the side of the road and needed a good place to eat. We walked into Honey Bears and was greeted by Mark, the owner. Mark treated us like family! We were hooked up with meaty mac and cheese. Which is mac and cheese, baked beans and shredded pork on top. TO DIE FOR. Mark charged our phones so we can contact a ride, fed us and left us feeling 10 times better than we did when we first walked in.   Thanks for the hospitality, Mark! (From the two girls in 80's clothes last year, Andi and Megan)

2-WGWLuLvTz4LUc10PGyCg.text: Loving located on notorious Van Buren, this hole-in-the-wall BBQ spot is legit one of the best places I've found in AZ. Obviously when you go for BBQ, you go for the meat and sauce. My chicken sliders could not have been more perfectly cooked and the sauce was just the amount of spicy, sweet, and overall delicious. My roomies had nothing to complain abouut their pork sandwiches. Definitely filling alone without the sides too, so it's hang for your buck. My only complaint would be the sassy guy at the register.

O8VjnY4PGBfL7FOIp1f1gQ.text: I wish there is a negative star option. This place is a total nightmare. The meat taste burnt and flavorless. Also overpriced at the same time.

xnQqLm52cVKcYwaz26qtAQ.text: I can to smell horrible alike vomit on brisket sandwich look not normal and I stop ate it can't eat all feel me disgust and I ate only beans ... honestly, I don't want go there never again ever....

KsFmLJP2w2OL1hUEAoMcKw.text: This is right around the corner from me so we decided to try it as we wanted some BBQ. The first time our order got messed up but the BBQ sauce and greens brought us back. The second time was atrocious. The chicken is DRY. The ribs have no flavor. Mac n cheese is disgusting along with the coleslaw. The beans, bbq sauce, and the greens are delicious so I will give them that. Also the owner himself is so nice but his son or whoever works the front area is NOT pleasant. He does not listen and when you tell him he made a mistake he says oh well I didn't ring that up or no you didn't say that or just negative stuff to not make him look at fault.

M1BE41Ve720KZgKvBKCLSA.text: Oooohh the good food we find in the ghettooooo!!   So yeah, when I moved to Az I didn't really know anyone, so of course I had no idea which areas were near 'bad', and which were closer to 'good'. I moved about 3 blocks away from Honey Bear's, and truthfully this place saved me a few times. Sure, it's on a street famous for hookers and activity deemed less than savory by most, but the bbq is solid.   Parking is ample and the staff is as down home as the bbq they dish out. Enjoy!

ZCpCL4MBLzou92jpUTc2Fg.text: HORRIBLE experience. Got a couple of the Groupons thinking it was a good deal and bc my dad grew up in Phoenix and we used to come here a while ago for their formerly good food and service. However, we will never be back again and opted not to even use our balance because of how poorly we were treated. The Groupon actually expired yesterday and I was really tired but was going to make the 40 minute drive anyways but I thought I'd call and just check to see if they would extend the offer til today as some company's are courteous in that way. I spoke to a gentleman on the phone and explained that I knew my Groupon was expiring that night but would they let me come today for the deal and he said yes that would be fine. So today I make the drive and was told "no" by the girl behind the counter. I explain the whole situation about calling last night and that I spoke to a guy and she just said "I know who you spoke to but that's not our policy so you can't get the deal."  No apology or attempt to rectify the situation.  I should probably add that there was NO ONE there and she could have easily extended our offer and established return customers but she had no custom service skills. When I asked her name she said it is Courtney but it looks like she has replied to reviews on here as "Anna S." so who knows. And after reading more reviews about ppl who have gotten food poisoning after eating here recently maybe it's for the better!

ZNO-lxTdHSPFxPWEROvpfg.text: HORRIBLE HORRIBLE HORRIBLE catfish taste like crunchy cardboard. HORRIBLE customer service in the van buran location. If you want some really good catfish papa joes is AWESOME!!! It's actually worst than one star, and they BOIL there ribs. SMH!!

i-nc4QEp_LlDh-nne63U-g.text: Unfortunately, I was underwhelmed with the flavor of the meat here.  Side dishes were pretty good. If you want a good smoke ring and flavorful meat I prefer Rudy's. However, if you're in downtown phx and don't want to travel to the 'burbs this place will do

ZErd-0FLwf2PNt5w5Yez2Q.text: Been going to Honey Bear's for around seven years and it is the BOMB! It is my favorite bbq place. I suggest you try it, especially if you like wet and saucy bbq. When Jesus comes back, I expect to see Honey Bear's Sauce ascend home :D If you want good BBQ and a no glits and glammour dinning room, you've found it.

MQMBPsB1XU1XQsKrD7myUg.text: quality in the food is inconsistent. i'm sure it depends on the cook of the day.  the only thing that consistently not dry and full of gristle is their pulled pork.  i have 2 groupons for this place and i'm hoping to try their catfish.

36SS_5s7qkPJwx8R_OqfZg.text: I can't remember how long it has been since I started going to Honey Bear's BBQ.  It has to be at least fifteen years.  I love this place.    I was there today for lunch and had the shredded chicken and a couple of hotlinks.  Delicious!!  Also had some coleslaw too.  I think I've had just about everything on the menu and it is all GREAT!  The service is good and the staff is always friendly.  If I have one complaint, it is that I am sticky and smell of BBQ sauce the rest of the day.... it could be worse.  Any place that's slogan is " You don't need no teeth to eat our meat"  has my vote.  The truth of the matter is, the slogan is right.

vmn2mOTtjx8KNc-ZWRc6_w.text: Went there on a Sunday... not busy... only 2-3 other tables. The place was clean and very BBQ-esque feeling (which is good!); HOWEVER, it may have been a bad day or personal issues or ?  ... The big bald guy at the counter (I can say that because I'm a big bald guy), had a very unfriendly attitude.  Like I said... he may have just been having a bad day, BUT... we almost left before trying the BBQ.   At then end of placing our order, we decided to add a piece of their sweet patato pie, listed on the wall menu... His response was only "No Pie Today".  No please... No Thank you... barely a grunt in reply to a question.  Definitely the the BEST RIBS I have ever had.  Tender, but not fall apart... slight crisp to the outside... plenty of meat on the bone and a great sauce with a little kick.  The food was so good I'll probably give it another try but I hope the big bald guy will be having a better day!

DJ2jilbck1Rc8c-dI4YcZw.text: Ok, so I haven't actually been to this location. I just had the BBQ from their tent at the Tempe Art Festival. When I got there the BBQ rib tips weren't ready yet. Mark Smith actually delivered them a couple blocks away to my office when they were ready, and he included extras. Such wonderful service, so nice! The BBQ sauce was amazing and I want to head to one of the full-menu locations to try their ribs. mmm

pdQXvvPRvYjdYGV1rKmTiA.text: Honey Bear BBQ is wet, messy, forget-yer-in-Arizona, hose yourself down with gallons of ice-tea when you're done, fun. The meat is so tender they must be getting it from animals who can't even stand up. The flavor of the sauce is a nice balance but leans a bit heavy on the sweet. But if this surprises you, you've simply forgotten the name of the place. Try any of the meat, and don't miss the beans. They taste like something went horribly wrong in the pot and someone tried to cover it up with ladle-fulls of honey, and just before throwing the whole mess out, realized "This is pretty damn GOOD!!! I'll go there every chance I get, but if you don't like sweet messy BBQ stay away.

SaeY9viQzAm231do-9zKxA.text: Ten years ago this was the BOMB!  Today,  They serve you with attitude or simply as a number.  The people who work at the front counter dont care about the food how it looks or what you ordered.  When the Management is around their spirits are a little different.  The food is good but the SOUL IS GONE.

L2mGuOgLCsrbtC1VK9hsDg.text: Yumm-o!  I love this place!  We eat here a lot.  I always get the ribs... and mix it up between the potato salad and the cole slaw.  The only thing I don't really like is sometimes they put too much pepper or something in their potato salad and cole slaw.  I'm not sure what that flavor is, but when there is too much, it ruins it for me.   But since I don't go there for potato salad and cole slaw, I'm pretty happy with the place, plus it's within walking distance from my apt.

lKaBYMPjpzoV2sb1gHjdEg.text: This is by far the best BBQ place in Phoenix IMO.  The only problem that I always ran into is what to get.  All the meats are smoked to perfection and the link are spiced just the way i like it.  The BBQ sauce is so good that I keep a gallon of this wonder in my fridge at all times.  Oh, and they also have Alcohol!!

JTea3PL-VYuQRcrwSEKlzw.text: Great BBQ and sides plus reasonable prices and service I will go back

_3znthGkKb8hDytkKpOHvg.text: Don't let the neighborhood turn you off - this is the BEST BBQ in Phoenix! Totally back to basics BBQ - no fancy fusion food here!  Try: Everything

uy0z2u_WJARgABhd59T-Tg.text: i'm confused.  i tried this place without looking at a review and i give it a 2 star.  but honey bears has a 4 star rating.  that's why i'm confused.  not sure if it was a bad day or what is going on.  the food was average to below average.  i did finish my food but that was about it.  my family was not to impressed either.  the inside experience was okay too.  after we left this restaurant we decided to never come back again.  but after reading so many positive reviews i'm may give it a second chance.

oFrAeBNn8qNMiAeiuTCHng.text: Good god damn is this some awesome chow.  Whenever we had some lame corporate event, there would almost always be Honey Bear's before in huge trays.  It was usually the only good thing that would happen.  They do everything good here.  By way way waaaay far the best BBQ in a 200 mile radius of Phoenix at least.

3WvAUpndr_ZadPJii2KbzA.text: "You don't need no teeth to eat our meat!" the slogan for Honey Bear's Bar-B-Q proudly proclaims and they are telling you the truth! Wonderfully tender and tasty pork, chicken and brisket that fall apart as you eat them in to an amborisa of meat and spicy sauce!  Honey Bear's has been a valley gem for decades, their original location a run building in Phoenix near Papago Park that you would never expect would house some of the finest barbecue this side of the Mississippi river. But the aroma would draw you in anyway.  That's how I first found them 20 some years ago, by smell while bicycling near Papago Park the wind brought the smells of the promise of smoked pork at it's finest. I was not disappointed then and never have been since.  Home of the hottest Hot Links around, Cowbro beans, Fried Catfish, Beef Brisket, Pulled Pork and Sweet Potato Pie.  Now Honey Bears has 4 valley locations, but success has not affected the wonderful quality of their food and their prices are the lowest anywhere for genuine slow smoked barbecue!

kZZXN1KrTCWxvvEV0iCelg.text: I am EXTREMELY happy they serve rib tips every day now. The sauce is amazing. Get buns to soak it all up. If you run out of buns, go to the store and buy more buns. Or you can mail me the sauce so I can dispose of it properly. Or not. Just don't waste the sauce.

J9L7jq-lLa-xqKqoQMGFag.text: I've been going to this particular one since 1987.  It was a ritual to go there right after the Copper World race, Indy car race and  the races at Manzanita.  Great food, great portions and great atmosphere.

6DJcSff3Payi6-HItOIJHw.text: Stopped in here yesterday as was in the mood for BBQ. Haven't ever really found a go to place for BBQ in the valley, and so was excited to try this place out. Little off the beaten path, but easy enough to find!  I'm a big brisket fan so I went with that along with a side of Mac & Cheese. The brisket was really good! The mac and cheese was great as well, and the two went together really well.   This is a great spot, plenty of seating, and helpful staff. Will definitely eat here again when I am crazing some BBQ!

DHYLv7tFhyxiBNH1zCIpsg.text: Great food! Bad business! We pre ordered, and paid for, in advance, 10 pounds of pulled chicken... come our Wedding day, no one has the order or any record of it! We had the receipt and had to demand that the order be filled! They actually complained and stated that giving it to us would wipe them out of their entire days supply of chicken! Um, too damn bad! We pre ordered and pre paid for it! So not only did they not have it, we got yelled at for it! Lol! Finally got the chicken!  Thank god for RUDY'S TEXAS BBQ, HIGLEY AMD THE 60! They saved the day and took care of the rest of our needs and our reception was a hit! We got all the sides of pickles, onions, jalapenos, bread, plates, cutlery, styrofoam cups, napkins! Far more and less price than what Honey Bear's offered! Sorry Honey Bear's! You Catering just couldn't compare to Rudy's!

EBgjvvCTPIu2t7k_aBUVmQ.text: When I first moved to the Valley my roommate took me here and he promised me it was good food. He was right it was good food but the prices are higher than I like. Its a once in a while treat but I could not eat here often. When I asked for extra sauce and I would have paid for it the counter help said the sauce is on the ribs and I said I would like some more and he just walked away. I understand that good help is hard to get so I just walked out with my food. We did purchase over a $100 food to go so I expected better service. I'm not mad I'm just not going to go back. I have found that costco ribs are really good and you can put the sauce you like on them. With the beef ribs there was a lot of fat and I don't eat fat. Like i said it was a treat but not one I'd repeat for in the future.

ukoMsy9YEvST_oRRZ0OG2w.text: We were at a Fourth of July celebration and Honey Bear's BBQ was serving up their favorites in their food truck. We had their chicken and pork cup, mac n cheese, and cole slaw. I didn't expect bbq to be that great from a food truck, but surprisingly it was quite tasty. The meat was tender and tasted even better with their signature bbq sauce. Service was speedy, ready within minutes after ordering!

tjjZxlAA0Klu6ycm6HwFIA.text: Came here for dinner tonight with some coworkers  from Singapore. Told them this was the BEST BBQ place in town. It did not disappoint! They were getting ready to close and we were ready to go somewhere else for dinner but the staff told us to stay and enjoy the food and place. My coworkers were not only impressed with the amazing hospitality of the staff but also the food! We had the ribs, coleslaw, bbq beans and the out of the world peach cobbler. This place is the best!!   Thank you Honey Bears Staff for a great night we left extremely happy and full!!

GaUjE-lBXmohSVU0RUjfUw.text: Great location great people great food they are beyond friendly making sure they get everything you need delicious bbq with the house made sauce they offer I love the pulled pork with coleslaw and extra sauce if you haven't tried it you absolutely won't regret it

wFIndsZzvZqfPV_APdbVBQ.text: So I had a few friends take me to Honeybears barbecue the other day and I thought it was really nice. The atmosphere was just kind of normal but the barbecue chicken was really good. And of course all of the other side dishes and fixings are also good. It looks like this place is a family place which I like. I guess the only downside was there wasn't enough seating because it was really busy and the interior was just kind of regular seating and nothing special. But the food was really good and I enjoyed myself and we had a good time.

uOiWEr6LwiTlZeLSCRrmgg.text: Good bbq for cheap, I've personally haven't had Tennessee style bbq before so it was different from my normal taste buds for bbq but it wasn't bad at all. Personally a fan of warm toasted buns for my sandwiches, and they serve untoasted buns but thats fine.
