eqA9IL5akZYN1-QJx1kbfw.text: Best place in town for barbeque. The staff is always friendly and the food yummy. Inevitably my eyes are bigger than my stomach so I get a take home box for more goodness later.

OX2S4Gps7oWVeCGA9WhxRA.text: My boyfriend decided to stop in a few weeks ago and order some food to go. He ordered a ribs and chicken combo, a hot-link sausage sandwich, and some side items (collard greens, bbq beans, and buns). I believe he paid about $30 for the food and the commute home was very short.   The best part of the entire meal was the collard greens and they were not even that good. The meat was flavorless and tough. We decided to save some of the meat as leftovers and ended up throwing it away a few days later. It was a first and a last time visit for my boyfriend. I had previously tried french fries on my own trip and also wings on another prior and they were so tasteless that I forgot to even write a review until now.

PWiCaHWPgALiYO118C1gnA.text: Ok so I would have to put this place at a 2 star. Nothing fancy but nice facility, clean but a little humid and hot for the dine in. One side has AC other side has swamp coolers or at least that's how it felt. With the big opening between the rooms the air was mixing and well coming from the hot environment out side to indoors I want to sit and be cool.  Food ok well I would say this is an average maybe a little below average bbq place nothing special, nothing to make it pop. The smoke on the ribs was good but only after I cleaned them off a little they were smothered in bbq sauce. I wanted the potato salad but they were out so I opt for the Mac and cheese. It was ok but the pepper was not crushed and every time  I took a bite I just got that really strong pepper taste that over powered the cheese. I ordered the rib deal 4 ribs, Mac and cheese some French fries and no drink and well 17.00 bucks is definitely not what I expected to pay for a little below average place. I personally don't plan on returning to this establishment but please go and give it a try for yourself! Thanks

Tdma21F8KMc8t3pAvHMVlQ.text: Waited in line for 45 mins. There out of MAC an cheese, there out of bbq sauce and out of 3 different sodas. I guess it would have been easier to go up to the counter and ask what do you have to eat. Not sure how a bbq place runs out of bbq sauce and lemonade.

4tD0Z5Oz9S5g5lSsOeBGuw.text: My mom has been dying for barbecue all summer and I brought her here for her birthday. She had the short ribs, which she said had more fat than meat on them, but still good. I had the pulled pork sandwich, which was very good.  We both had the mac and cheese as a side. It was creamy but had pepper in it. She was supposed to also get a side of cole slaw, but it never came. I'd go back again.

lbkvCsMjn0eDhjIs20tSjg.text: We visited Honey Bear's mobile BBQ at a Chandler event.  I was jazzed to see they had hot dogs because I just wanted something like to tide me over.  Darn good hot dogs.  Must be their own recipe for the dogs.  Cashier was a little clueless but that happens at a lot of places.

UCtzM47Lbnl8qjX49iXG-Q.text: There are an awful lot of BBQ joints around town with the recent increase in BBQ's popularity. Then there are some that have been around a bit longer, like Honey Bear's BBQ! The original location on Van Buren opened in 1986 and fortunately, it's right around the corner from my office.  Even though I'm on this side of town nearly every day, I was still happy to drive over toward 52nd Street to meet up with my girlfriend's brother for lunch. This place has plenty of seats despite how small it appears to be. And the "standing dining" lobby is a unique touch for those who are in a hurry to get back to work.  Now why would you wanna do that? Food this good needs to be savored and appreciated... Over a long lunch hour. But then again, my office is less than five minutes away.  I've dined at Honey Bears several times previously. I've even entertained clients here. Yeah it's a little on the "divey" side of things. But the food will make you forget about that.  Our lunch today was excellent as usual. The three slider combination is my go to entree. Unless it's Friday and they have catfish on hand. The pulled-pork, chicken and brisket are all tasty. And because this is Tennessee style, go grab some extra sauce. The sauce is so good, you'll be tempted to drink it.  Today's lunch was fun and we all enjoyed the food. Especially the "Cowbro Beans"! The only reason I deducted one star is because we were all looking forward to Peach Cobbler for dessert. They had none. And they were out of RC Cola. (Yeah, I like RC!) Oh, and no cornbread?! No worries, I'll swing by again for lunch soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Honey Bear's BBQ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. A picture is worth one thousand words. I can think of nearly as many to describe the meats here.
Photo of Honey Bear's BBQ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. One chicken, one brisket and one pulled-pork slider with the excellent Cowbro Beans!

oXXPuxOXvkNvKFjCAWdkaA.text: I have some regular business here in Arizona, plus both of my children are currently here attending university. When a client of mine took me to lunch and we pulled up to this establishment, I thought it was a joke. Well, as a man in his late 50's I still learn and relearn old lessons from time to time. In this case, not to judge a book by its cover. This place isn't much to look at to the point its almost enough to make you not give it a single opportunity. This is some of the best BBQ I've ever had! Hands down. The majority of my business takes place in the south/southwest and I favor heavily on the BBQ establishments. And despite the setting, this food is right up there with the best!

6YwhhGKzi-py-D6pWDvK2w.text: This place seems to be a Valley staple, so I had to try it despite some poor reviews. My experience was pretty good. Ordered two sandwich combos at $9.89 each. Usually don't comment on beverages, but the rare presence of Big Red in the soda machine was one I took advantage of right off the bat. Moving on to the side dishes, the macaroni and cheese was just average, a bit gummy, but the potato salad had large chunks of potatoes and a nice relishy taste. Ok, now onto the main courses. The chopped chicken is just that - 95% white meat chopped onto a bun. So, in this case the BBQ sauce better be good or else it will be one dry sandwich and luckily this sauce was tasty, kind of a thicker red vinegar style, but still a good taste and it gets soaked up fast. The Brisket was another huge sandwich, almost needing a knife and fork as meat spills everywhere (a good thing). This was shredded or chopped style brisket and I even found a few burnt ends buried amongst the meat. Hardly any fat and once again and that sauce made an appearance and "completed" the brisket very nicely. Place was pretty empty at 6:30pm on a weekday, just the way I like it.

photos.caption: Photo of Honey Bear's BBQ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chopped chicken sandwich

pWsaXkccL4f9DEx0Jcxl5g.text: Was not a fan. The service was horrible, pork was chewy and they were out of mac n cheese. The only good thing was they had Big Red on the fountain. I will not return.

-VjdBWynncvW07-LAQNylQ.text: BEWARE OF DECEPTIVE BUSINESS PRACTICES!!  I purchased a Groupon coupon which had no expiration date.  I tried to redeem the coupon they called the owner on the phone since he was not in the restaurant, and the owner said he was refusing to accept the coupon.  We pointed out the no expiration date and they still refused to honor what i paid for. As a consumer I feel they did not honor their agreement.

XzZ7YDufmYDGqPq-0psIsA.text: Some of the best around. I hadn't been to Honey Bears in years but stoped in for chicken and ribs.  They are still awsome and the slaw is spot on. The chicken was moist and flavofull. Dont be put off by the location or looks it is good food! And has been for years.

QngYEG9Ir00ThRynr7R1CQ.text: This is the second time I have been here and I feels it's average for BBQ. The potato salad was very cold, almost frozen and did not have any flavor. I was not full from my sandwich and since I didn't eat the potato salad was going to get peach cobbler but they didn't have any that day :-( Pretty "basic" place.

VlDPzonrVFJD35h1ivj7Bw.text: The way BBQ should be. Counter service, but plenty of tables. My wife & I split a full order of ribs.  This was a 3 day supply for us seniors. We both had cole slaw sides, my wife had the beans and I had the mac and cheese. Everything was very good. I have eaten there, or gotten take out many times when I worked at Sky Harbor. It was always good. I spoke with one of the owners regarding the flaws of the Tempe location (closed) and he agreed. There is nothing like this original location  if you want your stomach filled w/o emptying your wallet. We would go again

oom5aFMgCOisX2Vo9nq7GQ.text: I don't understand the fuzz about this place.   BBQ was not impressing, the weekend special Catfish was Okay. Side dishes were always disappointing. Price is high for the quality of the food.   I didn't hate it, but I would rather go somewhere else for BBQ.

G2WPUJBOOgVQvBvKiSpehQ.text: Not too impressed. The baked beans were way too sweet as is the BBQ sauce. So-so cole slaw and dry meat.

UtQ1cMQC73riu4za4cqKZw.text: Delicious BBQ! We got a coupon for half off on Groupon, which was the first bonus. When we arrived, the woman at the cashier was super sweet and helpful. She suggested her favorites and was patient with us while we decided. After we sat down to eat, the owner came and asked how our food was. THEN he came back with more sliders for us to try, for free! Such great service, delicious food! Next time I'm in Tempe, I'll definitely go back! Great job, Honey Bears!!

B1GreMm989HnsvglWK4keQ.text: Finally! An amazing place to get fantastic BBQ sandwiches in Phoenix! I went here for the first time a few weeks back (totally blanked out on the Yelp reviewing).  Some co-workers suggested we go there, saying it was one of the best places in The Valley for pork BBQ. They were right!  It's a tiny restaurant, and chances are you've driven by it a couple times but just have never noticed it. It's nothing fancy inside, just great service, great food and happy customers. I had one of the massive pork BBQ sandwiches on the menu and had flashbacks of the days when I lived in the Carolinas. MmmMmm deee-licious!  I could go on all day writing about how good Honey Bear's is, but I'll just let you go try it for yourself. Go on! Go!

dEUpLm24nekQUMiP6D7SBQ.text: I had Chicken and Ribs with beans and mac & cheese and it was finger licken good. If you like saucey BBQ this place is pretty good. Both the Rib and Chicken were falling off the bone and the beans were really good. I'm not usually in to the BBQ that is saucey I found myself stuffing my face. By the way... the serving size was huge.

PZfYs6XI1Y7C6IYpxCe1kg.text: I have been back to this Honey Bear's location several times since my first review.  And the place has gotten significantly worse on each subsequent visit.  This last visit will definitely be my last.  The place does not look well maintained at all and the food was an utter disappointment.  I ordered my usual hot link sandwich and my other half ordered a pulled pork sandwich.  My hot link sandwich was so so sad.  And the pulled pork sandwich was not only smaller and on different bread but also lacking taste or flavor, and add to that it not tasty.  Of course, it gave him heartburn later to his dismay   Now I need to find myself another place to sate my hot link cravings!.

2hCim0ov5B2OnnyDC3Nr_g.text: I dined here last week and had a half platter of ribs.  Some ribs had minimal meat and were dry.  Some ribs were great.  The BBQ sauce is a tangy red sauce.  Food I would rate a "3", I've had better, but it's not bad.  Location - this place was dirty and there was spilled BBQ on the floor near the cash register.  The cashier was aware of the spill but didn't clean it up promptly as she had to warn me to watch my step.  Another customer was complaining to them in Spanish on how they messed up his order.  Service/Cleanliness: 1.   Overall - this place deserves a 2.  Who would like this place?  Someone who's gotta have BBQ and nothing else serving BBQ nearby - it will do.

HynvkMxtTQntiLDp4uMtVg.text: Mediocre at best!  Who is writing these reviews and giving this place high marks? You don't know barbeque that's for sure. What's good about slices of processed meat with barbeque sause poured on them? What's good about ribs that are boiled with more sauce dumped on them. Huge disappointment and way overpriced, $24 for two servings of meat and one drink! I can go to Dickey's barbeque and have a better meal than this place for 1/2 the price.

d4IqPZdX3q1lSEvrGZGs7w.text: What the hell is in the sauce? I swear it's like crack. The more you have the more you want it and leaves you in a coma like state.   This is some seriously good bbq! The venue is not fancy at all just down to earth simple food in a cafeteria like setting.

VDDeGWyJJKps7d8ijK7YfA.text: Living in Phoenix, there are very few really good bbq spots, Honey Bears is an exception. Honey Bears is one of the best bbq restaurants that you will find in Arizona.  Honey Bears cooks Tennessee style bbq which is a sweet/tangy flavor. I'd say that the highlights of the menu are the ribs and pulled pork sandwich.   Their meat choices are pork, beef, chicken, and hot links. They also have a couple side dishes that are worth trying, the "cowbro beans" and potato salad.  Honey Bear's gets five stars for cooking up some of the best bbq in Arizona at a reasonable price.

Y3_tDKhweOfr7HaOAI3nbA.text: BBQ, a very unique experience, it is a truly American culinary art form that is diverse and has just as diverse group of passionate followers.  I would classify Honey Bears BBQ as awesome, in the wet BBQ mop using kind of BBQ.  If your perfect BBQ is a good dry rub BBQ brisket, or rack of ribs, you may want to skip.  However, if you are an individual who can enjoy the goodness of a pulled pork sandwich with a generous pool of their mostly sweet with a bit of spice/vinegar BBQ sauce, this could be your place.    I love Honey Bears, it reminds me of a BBQ stand at a country fair that didn't leave town when the fair moved on.  You walk right up to the window order your BBQ they give you a cup to fill with soda and a number that they will call out over a intercom.    It is not somewhere you take some one to "wine and dine" but it is a great place to grab a sandwich with a friend.  And do not skip out on the peach cobbler, very sweet and filled with tasty peaches you will not be disappointed.

twlecYoAFqb0ImtMaKlppw.text: I've been slipping by here for over 25 year's .  l moved to LA 17 years ago .  brought the fam in today what a complete disappointment........ The hot links were boiled not grilled...... I asked why and the Asian lady said the grill wasn't on yet.  I asked why she didn't mention the fact the grill wasn't on when I ordered them she said she would check if the lady in back could warm them up, I exploded!!!! I asked if the place changed hand and she said NO....... In the past the boys bent over backwards to please. Not today, not one bro there.  I told her to take it back, no apologizing nothing....... I even left a 15% tip when I payed at the counter before I had to pick up my food.... Sad to say never again........ The bros should pay attention to this website as it would help their business greatly.  By the looks of it only the reviewers care.  The brisket  was great, half chicken was dry, corn mushy, and the ribs were good.

KlfYWkdMmPxVK0SZbj41Rg.text: totally disappointed .. so sorry honey bear i was looking to build a brand new relationship with you but you feel totally short ... i ordered pork ribs (the only ribs they sell) ... tougher than I wished, not allot of TLC here.  I ordered hot links and was very disappointed .. hey everybody has their own idea of bbq so to his her own

f9oRFFgI3oY6oJvC8iRLpw.text: This place really needs an overhaul.  It really did not feel clean to me at all. Place was empty, but trash cans were overflowing and dirty.  The tables were not wiped off and there was meat on the floor.  With nothing going on in the place, why weren't the staff cleaning up?  The food was good, but with the way the place looks and feels, I wouldn't go back.  The owner needs to update this place, and soon!

paCaHbUFOgP3qh-ZuapMkg.text: I had the need to feed 40 birthday party goers last weekend. I thought BBQ and then i thought Honey Bears. I gave them a call a week in advance with my menu selections and itinerary. I arranged to pick up the food at the VanBuren location at 3:00 on a Saturday afternoon, I arrived at 3:00 just as they were finishing packaging everything up for the ride. They were timely, the food was hot, the sides were perfect and the price was a value. The people at the party that knew Honey Bears were delighted those that didn't became fans that Saturday. My thanks to Mark and the staff at Honey Bears. They make feeding large groups cost effective and easy.

_1vwvYtQDQVgSOJt1e0Xdw.text: First off I am extremely picky when it comes to bbq. So I always go into a new BBQ joint with high expectations. I came here with my boyfriend and he just ordered for us. A full rack of ribs, mac n cheese, collard greens, and corn bread. I picked up my first rib and the meat quite literally fell off the bone. It was juicy and exploded with flavor. Collared greens were cooked to perfection, and the mac n cheese was perfect. Oh then while I wasn't looking my boyfriend decided to order a piece of sweet potato pie...and I am so happy he did. I will definitely be coming back to try as many things on the menu as possible.

LCXpvHTo-suJIo2cuQIDew.text: Decent food but the counter service sucks. The guy running the register seemed to have a chip on his shoulder and was irritated at every question I asked. When I drop over $40 for lunch , it would be nice to get a "thank you" or "have a nice day" but you'll get none of that here. I felt very unwelcome here so I will not be back.

Hzw52dtmzuYLkVa6mBBUIg.text: We've been here before and the food and service were very good. Today however was a very different story! The young guy taking our order seemed completely confused. We ordered 2 kid meals and 4 adult meals and he only charged us $13.95. When we tried to argue and pay the right amount he smiled and just acted like he didn't know what we were talking about. I hope to god that the owner wises up and fires this idiot. He's gotta be losing tons of money from this fool! On top of the idiotic service, the ribs were fatty and chewy, the collard greens never saw a ham bone and the corn on the cob tasted like last weeks reheated mess. Definitely don't recommend this place!

RFPLK6HfK1IqmIdZdyn1gQ.text: The guy at the cashier was very chill and friendly.   We ordered the value meal with 3 pieces of ribs, pulled pork sandwich plus a side of mac  & cheese. The BBQ sauce was goood. The ribs were good too but I just hiked Squaw Peak for the first time when I went there so I was really really exhausted and hungry that I'd pretty much eat anything. So, I'm not sure. It's worth a try though!  By the way, thanks to Yelp we got $2 off! We also ordered peach cobbler and sweet potato pie for dessert, and they were delicious!  Will we visit again? For sure!

CqKMRFlDZFXE5v18wkGjLw.text: This place use to be great. Not so much anymore. The lady that took our to go order was not pleasant. Probably won't return. They've changed the BBQ sauce. Who actually owns this place?

cjS38VTAwRXeAblEvLR7jw.text: Came here after finding a voucher on Restaurant.com. Very happy with our meal. Friendly, quick service. I had the ribs and sandwich (chicken) combo with two sides (corn on the cob and mac n' cheese) and my husband had the three slider combo with a side of mac n' cheese. All very tasty. The gentleman behind the counter brought us some of their baked beans on the house and they were amazing. We'll definitely have to come back as we didn't have room for dessert!

7W0UHp5BKxKQntzIDM-AKA.text: None of these negative reviews are valid whatsoever. The place is very clean, the staff is amazing, and the food is great. I got the beef brisket sandwich which is good, but these baked beans are AMAZING. I've eaten a lot of BBQ in my day and their beans blow other places out of the water (specifically rudys who claims to be the king of em).   The owner Mark and his staff are very generous and personal individuals which is another key reason I'll continue to come back.

OWFHlEnlqpicWU-SLcq1MQ.text: Sad I didn't try the ribs they looked really good. Instead I went with the pulled pork sandwich which was good but not worth the price.   Not too impressed and left feeling like I had paid too much for an alright lunch.

FPdrE-qxl69fOMQuVu0Abw.text: Foods pretty good. Counter staff is horrible. We have been here 4 times in the last month and I am completely unsatisfied with the staff. The collard greens are very good. It would be nice if the staff matched the food.

tM7pjomyrQVHa0awxhavJg.text: I'm from Chicago and dying for some fantastic tasting ribs, other than those that I BBQ myself. Everyone pointed me to Honey Bear's BBQ.  The place is clean and casual, and the service is OK. But the ribs were horrible. The beer was fantastic though and I first thought maybe the alcohol had dulled my taste buds. I remember screaming, "Either this is a poor cut of beef/pork or both animals had mad cow/pig disease!"  I decided to return and give them another chance, and not order alcohol. I ordered the ribs and again, "Mad Cow Disease!"  I won't ever return. How does that go: "First time shame on you, second time shame on me..."

UMhqGRJ4xYJH2eTr5E4rVA.text: The food is very dry and the place is super dirty. Would not recommend. Never been to the one on Central Ave so cant speak to that one.

u0fdaY68_q-RLrFW24D0zQ.text: One star is generous. If you're looking for good bbq, go elsewhere. I'm a huge fan of brisket. I think it is the True high water mark of bbq. I ordered the brisket at this location. I'm not sure what came out.   I was given a half pound of mush, absolutely drenched in bbq sauce. Why put out bbq sauce if you're just gonna smother my order in it?  Brisket should be served in slices and BBQ sauce should be applied by the customer. There was not one discernible slice. It was like when you leave shredded wheat in the milk too long. Between that, the gallon of sauce, and the tremendous amount of grease, it was like a bowl of nasty soup.   While AZ isn't known for BBQ quite yet, avoid this place if you get the urge. Rudy's kills this place any day of the week.

y-nMJwxiwxo1Wwvl1SYWzg.text: That's what I'm talkin' 'bout! This place is not fully hood, but it is close. They have a large selection to chose from, and I wasn't sure what to chose until I saw a nice value menu. I finally chose the three slider option - a pork, a chicken and a beef. A large pot of sauce on the table provided the right amount of sauce to be added to the sandwiches. I was surprised at how quickly the order was ready. My friend ordered and as she was getting her soda, her number was called.   The soda selection was another interesting feature. No Coke or Pepsi here - RC, Diet Rite, Big Red, Country Time, and Sunkist mark a few of the selections that do not appear on most restaurant menus. There is plenty of seating in the dining room.  A good selection of sides to chose from (I went with the potato salad).  The flavor of the meat was excellent and each slider was overstuffed. When you see the sandwich, you know you are going to wear it - which is another sign of a great BBQ establishment. You will need plenty of napkins with this one!   My first experience here will not be my last. This place has jumped near the top of my list of BBQ pursuits.

BNclrmKRr4D6ptC1OyuNTA.text: Let's be honest, when it comes to BBQ places that are decent, the valley is sorely lacking.  So, when I brought up the fact that I was having a serious itch for some Q, a coworker brought Honey Bear's up. Having not heard of it, I was in for it.  The establishment is a hole in the wall, butsome of the best BBQ I have ever had was in holes in the wall (i.e. Aurthur Bryant's in Kansas City). We got out of the car and were greeted by the pleasant smell of wood smoking meat, and it smelled awesome. I was super excited...until we stepped into the door.  The aroma went from pecan wood chips to backed up sewage. I kid you not it smelled like someone emptied their bowels in the middle of the lobby. People would come in and turn right back around and leave. But, my friend assured me this was the place to be so darn it, I was going to stick it out.  I got the BBQ chicken sandwich. The sauce had very little flavor to it but the meat was tender (there is your one star, the ability to not dry out chicken). I asked about what side the cashier would prefer and she just shrugged and said "I guess the potato salad." As expected from the response, it was mediocre.  But that smell went back with me to the office where a coworker asked if I had been sitting in an alley with a drunk during lunch. I had to change my shirt but the smell was burned into my nostrils.  Never again...NEVER...AGAIN.

xwgHpMaJ96JWzWNFgyTqLg.text: Great food, typically nice BBQ style eatery.  Front counter guy was very nice & informative

47rERsyiDb1roKyd_uoT5w.text: "Put some south in yo mouth" Boooyaaa~  Pretty darn good BBQ. I had the pulled pork sandwich, the meat was tender and I could really taste the hickory smoke. The sauce was thick and tangy (yes I went a little overboard with it). I got corn on the cob for the side and it was a little bland, as if it had been boiled too long. My friend opted for the catfish and I snuck a few bites, it was not over-breaded, just a thin light dusting and super juicy inside, next time I am going to order it. I had an ice tea and it was so strong I had to add water to it (which I love). Overall this was a great lunch and although I ate so much I almost put myself in a food coma I will definitely be back.

ek5otr0FgxWGNkvvChbHTw.text: It was my first time at Honey Bears. I went for lunch, so it was around 12:00.  They welcomed me in with a huge smile. The staff was really cool and gave me some suggestions.  I ordered the one meat and two sides meal. I got the pulled pork, the coleslaw, and the mac and cheese. When my order was called, they also gave me free ribs because I was a first timer and they wanted to see me come back. I thought that was really nice of them. The food was sooooo good. If you love old-school, messy, lick your finger BBQ you must check this place out. I love that it's rustic and old too. A very rare sight in Phoenix these day. I will return.... many times.

Es4sy5VxqhdwhGZsSHJdWw.text: Have been going to this restaurant and had it used for catering at parties in my home for 25 years always good food until today had my housekeeper pick up for four people when I got up from my nap I went to make my sandwich and it was all grizzle and fat it wasn't the pulled pork that soft you definitely needed teeth to eat their meat in fact I ended up giving it to my dog hopefully this was just an anomaly but it would be a while before I would go back

0jaO-2cWqTRzx3ney59rwg.text: The food wasn't very tasty. The bathrooms will make you leave and not even ask for your money back.

_H3JgOepEttJKJuaz_oX_Q.text: This place has great BBQ, and the sides are great too. The wife and I come here just to eat sometimes all the way from Gilbert.  It's a 25 min drive, but it's worth it. The workers are nice too. Clean place. I highly recommend for good BBQ!

hJ-nY2k2BEjp3SLRyMlUkg.text: Honey Bears BBQ is definitely worth checking out. What they lack in variety and options is made up in quality. The ribs were nice and the pork sandwich was tender. Unfortunately I will chose elsewhere next time for more options and a little more meat on the bones. Overall the food was good but nothing wow'd me.

photos.caption: Photo of Honey Bear's BBQ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ribs and pork sandwich with mac n cheese

PKmFe5WSbfT_eHzYj4N6ng.text: While at the recent Chandler Beer and BBQ festival, I decided to give Honey Bears a try.  I had never been there before and have heard them mentioned as one of the great BBQ joints in the Phoenix area.   What a disappointment. The ribs we ordered were tough and gristly and tasted like they had been "quick-cooked". I've made and eaten enough ribs to know when a piece of meat has been rushed. My guess is they were scrambling to meet the high demand of the event and took some shortcuts. (It was later in the day) If thats the case I would say its a shame to sacrifice quality to make a buck.   With all the new BBQ places popping up in the Phoenix area, there's no room for the ones that compromise. Just my luck with 20+ BBQ booths to choose from at the festival I picked the one that obviously does.

eLctn0VoyXqEbalPrHxoFw.text: It's good if you need a quick fix, otherwise I would go elsewhere. The quality of the food is excellent, don't get me wrong (their ribs are my go-to), I'm just not a fan of their sauces. Their BBQ beans are a must however and the cornbread muffins are amazing when they're fresh!

OyHopy6pLzt3HnmTvhPkFQ.text: CLASSIC BBQ JOINT !!!!!!  What a great place to get REAL BBQ !! The family owned and run aspect always appeals to me, and the casualness is pure downhome. This place reminds me of the authentic bbq joints in MPLS and St Paul MN, my hometown. The pulled pork sand was as good as any as I have ever had, and the sides were unique. Just eating something called "CowBro Beans" is an experience.  It maybe could be a little cleaner, but so could Famous Dave's. Worth the time and money. Don't miss out.

KW4g2tpnV7JWrkkE_C_ASg.text: Completely disappointed, use to be the spot back in the day. Shade of its former self, THIS PLACE IS FOR THE WEAK FOLKS NOW!!! Don't waste your time. My guy got a 1/4 chicken combo and only got one small piece of chicken that barely had any meat on it. And correct me if I'm wrong but I thought that when you order a 1/4 chicken it comes with a wing, breast, and thigh. Well that's what it use to be but not anymore. It gets one star only because my chicken slider was okay, but my fries were hard and under cooked, plus the cook never changed his gloves. Yuck!!!!

G87lTjhzVrv0zVnwhXT1pQ.text: Had the combo Meal #3 Sandwich & 2 Ribs, with the Beef Brisket sandwich, Cowbro' Beans & Mac and Cheese. Everything was terrific, the Mac & Cheese was just OK. The brisket & ribs were delicious, and the Cowbro' Beans were tasty too.

io_i4nyrNbI-7LqSWjG2OQ.text: This is one of my favorite barbecue ever.  Such great memories are tied to honey bears.  We've eaten in, had carry out and have had them cater.  Their meat is always tender, the beans are just awesome , the sauce is amazing.  It's all just super damn good.  It's low key to eat in and they are always kind. Bring your appetite. I suggest the chicken or the pork sandwich.

kM_DwSGlmIN3eYgV8rScXw.text: The place is not the most inviting. Very cafeteria like. The ribs were delicious. The cole slaw was very tasty. The cook was very kind and generous with the portion of ribs.

rSYKzmyNp2I-XI6ewR82MA.text: Darn good BBQ. Darn good price.  Good local joint to check out if you're in the neighborhood.  Pulled pork is to die for!

tWP_OZPktJ2FU1T8i4TM8g.text: They sold my bank card information. My wife and I dined in and were the only two there. The food was good. We paid with a debit card. 8 and 12 hours later two fraudulent charges appeared on our card. It was the only time we used the card that week. Clearly fraud from this establishment. AG has been contacted. AVOID!!!!

W946w2xBYztZuptbECmveg.text: Hole in the wall restaurant with excellent tasting food and great customer service (awesome owner at the Van Buren location). Recommend the peach cobbler, delicious!

9JdxFPX0D2GshcZpNmaWow.text: Have been going to this place/location for YEARS!! Needless to say, I wont be back to this establishment ever again, after I discovered a CLUMP of hair (view in photos at own risk) in my pulled pork. Highly disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Honey Bear's BBQ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Discovered this CLUMP of hair in my pulled pork.

GHcxKHYfNLIahjgC61uBRg.text: I'm writing this post to make sure no one wastes their lunch hour on this place. Although the BBQ is pretty good, it's not exceptional. After spending 20 minutes or so standing in line swatting away flies, there's a good chance that you'll get up to the front and realize that they are out of half of the options on the menu without warning. The location also leaves a lot to be desired. Highly recommend going to Hap's Pit BBQ right down the street instead.

holsu4cFdxttvyv_aIJMog.text: Been craving Honey Bears for a while now, finally drove up from Tucson and got my fix. My signature order is a pulled pork sandwich for any BBQ place I go. Honey Bear's did not disappoint, the pork was seasoned very well and was juicy. The sauce is more on the sweet side and not too thick. The mac n' cheese was very creamy and seasoned with pepper. I am a pepper person so I do not mind the little kick. Tried a rib and the small amount of meat that was on there came right off. Seasoned and cooked very well. I am not one to order ribs so I don't want to be too critical of them because they were very good, just thought they were a bit slim.   If you happen to catch a Cardinal's game in Glendale, Honey Bear's has a quick service stand INSIDE the stadium. Definitely a good game choice meal.

CjohjyaaPYq6vxsOt_xDKw.text: This was the best BBQ in town and I can't say that anymore. The prices are a little high for a pork Sandwich beans and a drink 11.39$.  They got my order wrong which wasn't a major deal. No sweetener for the tea besides regular sugar. The quality of the food and sauce is good but there are now much better BBQ choices nearby.  They could make some improvements.

VKYGZJ5XcVHF-GPFkI7Opw.text: I've been to the renowned "Memphis in May BBQ Festival," but Honey Bear's pulled pork and BBQ sauce is as good as any I've ever tasted.   Since the owners of this place come from TN, I guess that shouldn't come as a surprise. The pulled pork sandwich is out of this world. Honey Bear's motto is, "you don't need no teeth to eat our meat." And that's really True. It's slow-cooked, moist, and packed with flavor. The BBQ sauce is amazing. It's tangy and spicy, I'm thinking it might have a tomato and vinegar base, but I don't really know. My husband loves their hot links and spicy sausage. He's a rib guy too and says they're great.   Honey Bear's on Van Buren is a bit of a dive and it's located in a slightly dicey, but safe, location. I think the dumpy atmosphere adds to the down home feel of the place.

photos.caption: Photo of Honey Bear's BBQ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. OMG, the pulled pork sandwich.

ssec87hjekZ_Iwyfxbo4eQ.text: All the food was amazing - we made the mistake of ordering extra hot bbq sauce. It is no joke! it was delicious but had us all sweating and with runny noses. Ordered lunch for a group of 13. All the orders were correct. Love this place

hH4HZVqsFJ3vrJXwHn7zXw.text: Absolutely loved it, the meat was tender, smokey, and the BBQ wasn't overwhelming so you can actually appreciate the flavors. Rib meat came off the bone with ease. Brisket was awesome and so was the pulled pork.

bzJThYcvCnL8MYniKwMH1Q.text: I am a huge BBQ fan and this place did not disappoint! I have had BBQ at some legit places in Las Vegas (where I am from) but these guys are the best I have had in years! The meat is tender, the sauce is perfect, the sides are amazing, The staff was unique and the inside was cozy and inviting. If you want authentic Tennessee BBQ done right then this will hit the spot for you! I can't wait to visit you next time I come to Phoenix! Thank you for a very yummy experience!
